description:
ABOUT COCA-COLA EUROPACIFIC PARTNERS 

We are Coca-Cola Europacific Partners (CCEP) – a dedicated team of 42,000 people, serving customers in 31 countries, who work together to make, move and sell some of the world’s most loved drinks. We are a global business and one of the leading consumer goods companies in the world. We help our 2.1 million customers grow, and we are constantly investing in exciting new products, innovative technologies and fresh ideas. This helps us to delight the 600 million people who enjoy our drinks every day.

 

ABOUT YOUR ROLE

This is an exciting opportunity for a highly skilled, business focused and ERP experienced Business Analyst who has a proven track record in business process design and has worked in a FMCG or large scale, complex environment.

Working closely with the BPT Business Partner, Corporate Functions and the CIO, this role will see you bring to life your skills across Project Initiation and Delivery, Reporting, BPT Governance, Communications and Stakeholder Management assisting the areas of Finance, P&C, PACS and Legal & Procurement

 

WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING

  • Support the relationship between BPT and the Australian Support Functions, assuming the role of trusted advisor to the business function leads.
  • Shape and scope support functions business demand into tangible requirements in-line with the BPT Project Delivery Lifecycle.
  • Responsible for the development of robust, detailed business cases for project requests, in collaboration with the business stakeholders.
  • Demonstrate BPT’s value to business stakeholders and display the capabilities and flexibility of BPT to deliver at the pace which the business requires.
  • Appraise any business process changes for BPT impact, working closely with Enterprise Architecture and BPT Strategy teams, to formulate a change impact analysis for the stakeholders. 
  • Support the Australian Support Functions during the deployment phase of projects, to maximize solution adoption and benefits realization, in close collaboration with colleagues in the Solution Delivery Team.
  • Facilitate the alignment of the BPT strategy and priorities, with changing business priorities.

 

LET’S TALK ABOUT YOU!

  • 5-7 years of business focused IT experience, ideally with functional / technical experience
  • SAP experience is essential.
  • Demonstrable relationship building experience with business and technology stakeholders.
  • Proven track record of delivering technology-driven change.
  • Solid understanding of both system and process technology concepts.
  • Solid understanding of business processes within and across business functions.
  • Experience working in a global matrixed organisation.
  • Knowledge of Portfolio Management / Project Management / Change Management methodologies is desirable.
  • Solid foundational Financial Acumen.
  • Knowledge of trends and technology developments in the context of Support Functions
  • High level of drive, energy, tenacity, and a desire for professional excellence.
  • Ability to prioritise own workload and co-ordinate several tasks simultaneously.
  • Ability to communicate and engage stakeholders and service providers in technical and non-technical discussions.
  • Must have strong organisational skills, ability to work independently and be a self-motivated, detail-oriented, dedicated, and well-organised project professional able to work and make decisions in a high-performing environment.
  • Strong interpersonal and leadership skills to instill a strong vision for the program with the ability to influence and mentor others.

 

WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU? 

  • Working with one of the world’s most recognisable brands.
  • Free monthly product allowances to share with family and friends (including Coca-Cola, Mount Franklin, Monster, and more!).
  • Access to our corporate benefits including Fitness Passport & discounts with our many diverse customers including Microsoft, Lenovo, Hertz, GoGet and Estee Lauder.
  • Free counselling for you and your family via our EAP helpline as part of our commitment to well-being.
  • Unlimited drinks onsite.

 

WHY CHOOSE US FOR YOUR NEXT ROLE?

We have an amazing culture at CCEP, to find out more make sure you check out the people stories on our website here

Applications close on Tuesday 29th July 2024

 

At Coca-Cola Europacific Partners, we are always refreshing the way we work and becoming a more inclusive, diverse and equitable company. It’s important to us that you have the best recruitment experience possible, therefore, please let us know what support we can put in place for you in terms of any accessibility adjustments throughout the recruitment process.

Coca-Cola Europacific is committed to the health and safety of all employees and to equal employment opportunity for all employees to ensure that our employees have a safe work environment that is also free of discrimination and harassment.

This role will be subject to our standard pre-employment checks, which includes employment references, working rights and/or medical check, background checks, dependent on role.
teaser: This is an exciting opportunity for a highly skilled, business focused and ERP experienced Business Analyst to join a global FMCG icon
title: Business Analyst
bulletPoints: High profile, trusted partner working with Corporate Functions Teams.
Great team, culture and benefits

description:
Our business analysts are the drivers behind our continued growth and success. With our commitment to continuous innovation, it’s our business analysts who seek out, develop, and help implement strategic initiatives for improved customer experience, efficiency and productivity.

As a Business Analyst you work in specialist project teams on growth initiatives, pricing, customer experience, regulatory and compliance, product and process improvements. 

You will be required to provide direction to squad members and peers by collaborating across our business; identifying and initiating projects; driving the resolution of any issues that arise and holding themselves and the team accountable for results.

Let’s look at some key responsibilities:

  • Work closely with the Product and Development teams to help prioritise and manage requirements
  • Facilitate workshops with stakeholders to elicit, analyse and validate business processes, systems, and requirements
  • Working closely with CX and UX to ensure the solution delivers best possible customer experience
  • Maintaining the requirement repository with business rules and necessary process maps in Confluence
  • Creating and maintaining user stories and acceptance criteria in JIRA
  • Presenting information using visualisation techniques (e.g. process map, journey map, personas)
  • Providing support to Product and Tech at discovery stage such as creating hypothesis using lean canvas, product roadmap, high level requirements/epics/features, technical feasibility
  • Acting as a liaison between technical teams and business teams/end-users, by translating technical terminology through simple oral and visual techniques and tools;
  • Collaborate with squad members to clarify requirements and validate the implementation
  • Support the requirements through development, testing and implementation phases or sprints.
  • Liaising with other squads and projects when cross functional dependencies are identified.
  • Liaising with external vendors who are delivering solution components through requirements, development, testing and implementation. 

 Ideally, we're looking for the following: 
Let’s look at you:

  • Business Analysis experience in a complex business domain, fintech, or fast growing fin services would be great
  • Experience working as a Waterfall and Agile Business Analyst in a cross-functional Digital squad
  • Understanding of Waterfall and Agile delivery (Scrum and/or Kanban)
  • Excellent communicator with the ability to translate data into actionable insights
  • Strong stakeholder management skills such as influence, negotiation and conflict resolution skills
  • Strong written, verbal and presentation skills
  • Mental agility and a growth mindset.
  • Experience using Confluence and JIRA.
  • Knowledge of Process mapping using BPMN 2.0

Desirable 

  • 1-2 years Business Analysis experience
  • Credit Card and Loan Origination expertise
  • Some Financial Services / FinTech Industry experience preferred
  • Industry certification in Agile (e.g. SCRUM)
  • Industry certification in Business Analysis (e.g. CBAP)\

Sometimes the best candidates don’t have 100% of what is listed above, but if you have most and are confident you’d be a good fit, we’d love to hear from you!

  • Recognition @ Latitude: Education support, Better giving programme with charity partners, Latitude matches dollar for dollar and Community partner days
  •  Flexibility @ Latitude: Flexible work arrangements - balance work and personal responsibilities, Hybrid set up - work from home & the office, 3 Days paid volunteer leave annually, paid community service leave, paid compassionate / bereavement leave
  • Yearly salary reviews. 

Sound like you? That's a good sign! In return for your energy and ideas, we offer a flexible working environment and great compensation. We always support a safe, healthy, engaging, and productive working environment for all employees and workers, whether that be in your home and office, or a combination of both.

We're Latitude, partners in money Latitude may seem like the new kid on the block, but it's taken us almost a hundred years to become an overnight success. Digital payments, cards, loans are what we offer - but what we really are is a platform that helps people shop and live better. Always living and breathing our values. Act Right, Show Care, Be Curious.

Successful applicants will be required to complete a background check (including criminal history and bankruptcy check) prior to commencement of employment. Only open to Australian or New Zealand Permanent Residents or Citizens.

Thrive in a positive, dynamic and fun culture

description:
Support Engineer

 

We are a small but quickly expanding MSP with needs to employ a support engineer to join our dynamic and down-to-earth team.  We are looking for someone with Level 2 experience.

Full time position. $70,000+ Super

We need someone with good written and verbal communication skills to interact with clients of various technical levels. Must be good with time management, must have attention to detail and be able to work with minimal supervision. Self-motivated to excel in whatever tasks are undertaken and have enough technical knowledge and experience to carry out general day to day IT support tasks.

Your main responsibilities will be providing technical support for business customers on helpdesk and onsite. The tasks will range from any of the following:

 

  • Incident management – diagnosis and troubleshooting of service desk tickets
  • Support end user with provided solutions (Office 365, business applications, VOIP, Internet etc)
  • Escalate incidents and problems for resolution by appropriate staff and vendors
  • Experience configuring, administering Microsoft Office 365; including migration and other Azure services.
  • Knowledge of IP networking, DHCP, DNS and general network principles.

 

If you have the following skills/knowledge and want to work for a company that is growing, then apply now! Must have the following to apply.

  • Microsoft qualifications with at least 2 years Industry experience in Australia with level 2 technical ability.
  • Experience in supporting customers at their office and over the phone.
  • Full understanding of Networking with Firewall and VPN Experience.
  • Good experience with Microsoft Server Products and Hyper-V environments.
  • Full knowledge and experience of office 365 including experience in migrations.
  • Having N-Central Management knowledge would be highly desirable.
  • A high level of initiative 
  • Willingness to learn new skills and systems
  • Excellent communication skills both written and verbal
  • Ability to manage service requests, incidents, and assets in a service desk tool
  • Previous experience with VOIP technology preferrable

 

Must have the following additional requirements,

Must be permanent resident for the past 5 years.

Must be fluent English speaking and have great personal skills.

Must have full driver's license.

 

If this role is what you've been looking for, please apply.
teaser: Be part of our great team with great work/life balance.
title: Level 2 Support Engineer - MSP

description:
The Story

A leading provider of health services in Australia, is looking to find an IT Site Support Coordinator, to join their Service Delivery Team. 

This team is on a mission to develop culture and capacity that thrives on collaboration, positivity, being people oriented, friendly and achievement focussed. They are customer "obsessed" and encourage and reward innovation and continuous improvement! 

The Role

No two days will ever be the same!

The role will ultimately provide exceptional onsite Level 2 support services across hospitals and administrative offices in the Gold Coast (also WA and NT, remotely).

You will work with a range of stakeholders, from doctors, office staff to tradies and work closely with Service Desk, Infrastructure, Network and Application teams to provide efficient support across MDM (iOS and Android), networks (WAN/LAN/Wireless), systems, hardware and devices.

The role will also be involved in the coordination of projects. (Pretty exciting!) 

What You Bring To The Role

  • Minimum 3 years experience in an IT support role, providing Level 2 support.
  • Experience providing support in desktop and server operating systems, network environments, telephony systems and cloud technologies.
  • Proven experience supporting Windows 10 and Office 2016.
  • Experience in Office 365 highly desired.
  • Experience in WebEx, Zoom, Teams and other collaboration/video conference technologies.
  • Experience in Imaging and Client Management tools such as SCCM and IP Based PBX Systems.
  • Experience in AD, including Security and Group Policy configuration.
  • Previous experience in or knowledge of health systems and procedures, highly desirable. 
What's In It For You

You'll get to work in an industry with purpose where your contribution enables healthcare care providers to deliver high quality levels of patient care.

This is a very collaborative and supportive team, who pride themselves in their commitment to service excellence, teamwork and integrity. There will be loads of on-the-job support and learning!

12 month fixed term contract, with the possibility of extension, based in the sunny Gold Coast.

Next Steps

Don't miss out on this amazing opportunity. Apply online or get in touch with any enquiries.
teaser: Join this industry leading healthcare provider in the sunny Gold Coast and provide exceptional IT support to users, in this very rewarding industry.
title: IT Site Support Coordinator

description:
Services Australia (the agency) is at the frontline of government service delivery, supporting millions of Australians.

We are TDP | Secure and simple digital government services that Australian's trust.

Technology and Digital Programs (TDP) makes it simple for Australians to interact digitally with government with some of the largest and most complex ICT environments in Australia. Our solutions are scalable, adaptable and position the Group as an industry leader. We operate cutting edge technology solutions critical to Australians citizens across major life events. Working in TDP, the opportunities are great and varied, you can grow your capabilities and develop a well-rounded ICT career. Be part of a dynamic, supportive and collaborative work environment.

The Cyber Security Division, within the Technology and Digital Programs Group is responsible for protecting the payments and services we deliver on behalf of government to the Australian community. We undertake the following:

  • Protect and defend access to our services 24x7 in our world-class Cyber Security Operations Centre.
  • Protect the information systems of our shared services clients.
  • Protect our networks and secure our data to mitigate current and future cyber security risks.
  • Provide cyber security advice and support to business areas in the development and expansion of services.
  • Work collaboratively with the broad cyber security community, nationally and internationally, to share
  • information, ensure best practice and enhance cyber security strategies.
  • Raise awareness of cyber security with agency staff and the wider community.

Cyber Security Penetration Tester specialists are responsible for testing and investigating security infrastructure within an organisation. They analyse IT systems to determine configuration weaknesses and faults that could

affect security and business.

Penetration Testers/Experts conduct cyber penetration testing and vulnerability assessment activities. These can be quite complex and highly sensitive depending on the role. They simulate different types of cyber security

attacks and develop penetration testing methodologies, they also:

  • promote/lead the delivery of flexible, quality service to improve customer experience
  • work under the limited/broad direction of senior staff to deliver results
  • make ethical, evidence-based decisions using sound judgement
  • anticipate and respond/manage stakeholder relationships to ensure positive outcomes.

description:
Want to be part of a truly values-based organization making a difference to people’s lives?

We are currently recruiting for a Lead – Client Management Systems (Salesforce Administrator)

This role can be based out of our state offices in either Sydney or Melbourne.

 

About the role

The Lead, Client Management Systems is responsible for the overall management, configuration, and optimisation of the Salesforce platform with a focus on Lumary. This role ensures the system’s integrity, supports user needs, and facilitates data accuracy to drive operational efficiency. The incumbent will manage system customisations, provide end-user support and training, oversee integrations with other internal systems, and ensure compliance with industry regulations, including NDIS requirements. Additionally, the role involves continuous process improvement and collaboration with cross-functional teams to enhance business operations through the Lumary product.

Reporting to the Executive Director of Technology, this position works under general direction from senior employees and requires a well-developed understanding of the long-term goals of the organisation, as well as sector and government ways of working.

 

About us

Possability Group is a leading Australian non-profit, values-based organisation delivering a range of individual and flexible support options for people with a disability, and vulnerable people across Australia. Services include supported accommodation, employment, training, respite, and support for children & young people with a history of adversity.

Possability has a vision for a world where everyone has the opportunity to pursue their potential. We are catalysts for change in the broader community and in the lives of the people we serve. We believe that freedom and independence are fundamental human rights. We are committed to providing a quality service designed to be responsive and flexible to individual needs to enable people to achieve their personal goals.

 

About You

As the Lead – Client Management Systems, you will have:

  • A qualification such as a Batchelor of Computer Science or relevant undergraduate degree recognised by Possability and/or substantial industry experience in a similar role.
  • Demonstrated experience leading key business systems to achieve required strategic and operational outcomes.
  • Demonstrate specialist knowledge and capability to deliver contemporary and innovative services in the relevant sector gained through applicable experience training and education.
  • Well-developed ICT literacy and competency in all applicable MS Office products, and the demonstrated ability to quickly learn and apply new systems to achieve outcomes.

 

Other requirements for this role include:

  • Current unrestricted driver’s licence.
  • State-wide travel as required to meet business needs.
  • Provision of a satisfactory Police Check as required.
  • Provision of Working with Vulnerable People registration with NDIS endorsement.
  • Fully Vaccinated against Covid 19.

 

What’s next?

For further information on this role or to request a copy of the position description, please email  Jason.bowring@possability.com.au or call Jason on 0408 720 280.

 

If this position looks like your next challenge, please hit the apply button and submit your application through our online recruitment portal.

To be considered, applications must provide the following items:

-       A current curriculum vitae
-       A cover letter detailing why you are the right candidate for the role.
-       Confirmation of ability to meet essential role and organisation requirements 

 

Please note we will be conducting interviews with suitable candidates as applications are received, therefore candidates are encouraged to apply promptly.

 

Possability is proud to be an equal opportunity employer where every person can feel safe and participate in meaningful work. We are committed to workplace diversity and encourage employment applications from people with a disability, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people. To ensure that all clients and vulnerable people are protected, all employees are required to hold a current NDIS check, National Police check, WWVP Card, and be fully vaccinated against covid-19.

description:
Services Australia (the agency) is at the frontline of government service delivery, supporting millions of Australians.

We are TDP | Secure and simple digital government services that Australian's trust.

Technology and Digital Programs (TDP) makes it simple for Australians to interact digitally with government with some of the largest and most complex ICT environments in Australia. Our solutions are scalable, adaptable and position the Group as an industry leader. We operate cutting edge technology solutions critical to Australians citizens across major life events. Working in TDP, the opportunities are great and varied, you can grow your capabilities and develop a well-rounded ICT career. Be part of a dynamic, supportive and collaborative work environment.

The Cyber Security Division, within the Technology and Digital Programs Group is responsible for protecting the payments and services we deliver on behalf of government to the Australian community. We undertake the following:

  • Protect and defend access to our services 24x7 in our world-class Cyber Security Operations Centre.
  • Protect the information systems of our shared services clients.
  • Protect our networks and secure our data to mitigate current and future cyber security risks.
  • Provide cyber security advice and support to business areas in the development and expansion of services.
  • Work collaboratively with the broad cyber security community, nationally and internationally, to share
  • information, ensure best practice and enhance cyber security strategies.
  • Raise awareness of cyber security with agency staff and the wider community.

Cyber Security Penetration Tester specialists are responsible for testing and investigating security infrastructure within an organisation. They analyse IT systems to determine configuration weaknesses and faults that could

affect security and business.

Penetration Testers/Experts conduct cyber penetration testing and vulnerability assessment activities. These can be quite complex and highly sensitive depending on the role. They simulate different types of cyber security

attacks and develop penetration testing methodologies, they also:

  • promote/lead the delivery of flexible, quality service to improve customer experience
  • work under the limited/broad direction of senior staff to deliver results
  • make ethical, evidence-based decisions using sound judgement
  • anticipate and respond/manage stakeholder relationships to ensure positive outcomes.

description:
• Growing IT services organisation.
  • Professional development opportunity.
  • Sydney CBD location, close to public transport.

Green Light Worldwide is one of the most successful and fastest-growing IT service businesses in Australia. We offer a wide range of IT services in Security, infrastructure, and Systems Integration to a diverse customer base throughout Australia, New Zealand, SE Asia, North America, and Europe.

Green Light Worldwide is looking for a motivated engineer to provide support the internal delivery teams initially but as the opportunity evolves will have potential to engage with services and projects. You must have a strong technical knowledge base, communicate effectively, and be willing to adapt quickly to new technologies as the company improves on its current environment.

Responsibilities:
  • Supporting desktop infrastructure and services including Hardware, OS, Software, monitoring etc.
  • Deliver the best solutions based on the technical issue and information received.
  • Escalate any unresolved issues to next level of support.
  • Identify and suggest possible improvements on processes.
  • Perform face to face and remote troubleshooting to ensure successful resolution.
  • Work with Head of IT to Support configuration and project work across the M365 platform.
  • Hardware procurement, deployment, and asset tracking.
  • System auditing and compliance tasks.

Requirements:
  • Willingness to develop and enhance technical skills.
  • Experience in a technical support role both in person and remote support.
  • Comprehensive understanding of computer systems, networking, and general troubleshooting.
  • Experience supporting O365 platforms.
  • Proven ability to diagnose and resolve basic technical issues.
  • Excellent customer service and communication skills.
  • Advanced documentation skills and attention to detail.
  • Willingness to learn modern technologies and take ownership of project tasks.

Highly Regarded:
  • Experience working with Mobile Device Management platforms like Intune would be highly regarded.
  • Experience supporting Azure AD would be highly regarded.
  • Certification or experience in cyber security best practices would be highly regarded.

Benefits:
  • Ongoing professional career development.
  • Professional Training and Certifications.
  • Working with advanced cutting-edge technologies in cloud and security.
  • Collaborative working culture.
teaser: Growing IT services organisation. Professional development opportunity. Sydney CBD location, close to public transport. Green Light Worldwide
title: Desktop Support Analyst

description:
Green Light Worldwide is currently helping our client, who provides a range of IT and national and international telecommunication services to business and government customers in Australia. Our client is seeking two new team members for their network & gateway team.

Role Details
  • 12-Month Contract.
  • Must be based in Canberra.
The Tier 1 role within the business is a junior network engineering role. You will be responsible for many services that are managed by our client's gateway services.

You will be monitoring, managing and advising customers on the products and services that our client offers. This will include configuring devices to meet customer requests and expectations, ensuring that we are following IRAP and security protocols.

Daily Tasks
  • Configure routers, switches, firewalls, proxy's DNS servers and Load balancers.
  • Handle customer phone calls, triage and troubleshoot when required.
  • Monitor all of the gateway services and investigate any alerts, outages or issues with the assistance of Senior engineers.
  • Update procedures and processes when required.
  • Manage internal and external escalations and communications.
  • Watch and action the service desk inbox.
  • Manage and action the ticket queues ensuring they are always updated within 48 hours.
Additional Role Information

This role is for entry level engineers, people looking for career changes or those seasoned in networking and want the larger range of experience working in a gateway can provide.

The position will provide the candidate with as much knowledge and experience as they wish to grant. Once fully capable with the role and responsibilities of the Tier 1 role, engineers are given the option to expand and take on Tier 2/3 workload if they wish.

You will be trained in the gateway environment for our clients' Federal Government and Defence clients.

Applicant Requirements

Do to the nature of the work and the end client being Federal Government Departments, please note:
  • You must be an Australian Citizen to apply.
  • You must possess a current AGSVA Security Clearance.
Please Contact

Joe Pivac 
Senior Resource Manager
Green Light Worldwide – Empowering our partners to prosper

Our client is renowned for the impact it has on the Australian community. Technology underpins their success in being able to reach and service the community faster and in a more meaningful way.

As an Enterprise Architect you will be an advocate for both business and IT and ensuring high quality, fit for purpose enterprise architecture that aligns with corporate plan and leveraging IT's strengths.

Given the nature of the work they do, the successful candidate must hold an Australian Citizenship.

To be considered we seek:

  • 10+ years of Architecture experience within large, complex ennvironments
  • Significant Enterprise Architecture experience and the ability to work across multi-domain (applications, integrations, data, infra, etc), multi-project and program experience.
  • Industry experience across financial, health or insurance sectors would be highly advantageous.
  • Adept with various Enterprise Architecture models, methodologies, principles, policies, standards.
  • Well versed in representing solutions in the Architecture Review Board.
  • Exceptional communications and interpersonal skills, with the ability to communicate effectively across all levels across business and IT.
  • Able to attend 3 days each week in the office, with flexible arrangements in place for the remaining 2 days.
  • Hold an Australian Citizenship with eligibility for Baseline clearance.

If this sounds like you, please send through your application via the 'Apply Now' button.

description:
Services Australia (the agency) is at the frontline of government service delivery, supporting millions of Australians.

We are TDP | Secure and simple digital government services that Australian's trust.

Technology and Digital Programs (TDP) makes it simple for Australians to interact digitally with government with some of the largest and most complex ICT environments in Australia. Our solutions are scalable, adaptable and position the Group as an industry leader. We operate cutting edge technology solutions critical to Australians citizens across major life events. Working in TDP, the opportunities are great and varied, you can grow your capabilities and develop a well-rounded ICT career. Be part of a dynamic, supportive and collaborative work environment.

The Infrastructure and Operations division maintains national critical infrastructure for Services Australia and across government. We deliver a robust, secure, and resilient ICT environment so Australian citizens can access government services 24x7.

 

The Core Infrastructure branch delivers network, telecommunications, gateway, data centre facilities, cloud connectivity and computing (mid-range and mainframe) and storage infrastructure. Our cutting-edge mainframe infrastructure is the largest in the country, supporting the Centrelink, Medicare, and Child Support programs. Our network covers more than 1,000 locations across Australia and supports secure network and gateway services for 12 other government agencies.

We are seeking to fill roles for both Infrastructure Engineers and Network Engineers within the branch.
teaser: Services Australia is seeking Infrastructure/Network Engineers to join Technology and Digital Programs
title: Infrastructure Engineer/Network Engineer
bulletPoints: Work in an interactive and dynamic environment
Every day brings new challenges
Be part of an organisation with a strong future

description:
About Collins Foods Limited

Collins Foods is an ASX listed company proudly employing over 17,000 employees globally. With a vision to be the World’s Top Restaurant Operator, we operate over 350 KFC restaurants in Australia, The Netherlands and Germany, and 27 Taco Bell restaurants in Queensland, Victoria & Western Australia.

Why work for Collins Foods?

Our mission at Collins is Restaurants Done Better. We have an obsession for raising the bar on what people think a restaurant experience should be. More Human. More Sustainable. More Digital. More Fun. In addition to working with iconic international brands, there are many advantages to joining the Collins Family. As part of your valuable contribution, you will be rewarded with:

  • Competitive remuneration + short-term incentive bonus program
  • Access up to 13 paid "Recharge Days" per year. That's a 4-day working week every 4 weeks
  • Ongoing professional development opportunities
  • Flexible working arrangements, including WFH options 1-2 days per week.
  • Access to a formal mentorship program
  • Autonomy and independence to create your own success
  • Commitment to 25% energy reduction by 2026

The Role

The primary responsibility of the Project Manager (Information Technology) is leading and managing the successful delivery of technology-driven projects within Collins Foods. This role ensures that all technology initiatives are aligned with business goals and are delivered on time, within scope, and budget. The Project Manager (Information Technology) coordinates cross-functional teams, manages stakeholder relationships, mitigates risks, and ensures adherence to best practices in project management.

The role requires a strategic mindset to manage complex projects, including the development, implementation, and optimisation of core technology platforms and enterprise systems. The Project Manager (Information Technology) plays a crucial role in bridging technical and business teams, ensuring that technology solutions meet both functional and operational requirements, ultimately contributing to the Collins Foods’ digital transformation objectives.

Key Duties & Responsibilities

  • Scope and Requirements Gathering: Collaborate with functional key stakeholders to define detailed project requirements, ensuring technology investments align with business objectives and user needs.
  • RFI/RFP Process: Lead RFI and RFP processes to identify and evaluate potential vendors and solutions. This includes preparing documents, managing submissions, and conducting thorough analysis to shortlist suitable options.
  • Business Case Development: Develop compelling business cases for the investment initiatives, articulating the benefits, costs, risk assessment, and return on investment (ROI) to secure executive sponsorship and funding.
  • Project Planning and Design: Create detailed project plans, including scope, budget, and schedule. Assign responsibilities and allocate resources effectively.
  • Stakeholder Management: Serve as the primary liaison for all project stakeholders, facilitating clear and consistent communication throughout the project lifecycle.

Project management

  • Risk and Change Management: Proactively identify and mitigate project risks. Manage changes to project scope, schedule, and costs through a formal change management process.
  • Quality Assurance: Ensure all project deliverables meet the highest quality standards and comply with industry best practices.
  • Delivery and Implementation: Guarantee timely project completion within budget and scope parameters. Oversee the investment implementation, coordinating with cross functional teams to ensure a smooth transition.

About You

Skills & Experience

  • Leadership: Strong leadership abilities to guide and motivate project teams, manage stakeholders, and drive project success.
  • Communication: Excellent verbal and written communication skills to effectively liaise with, and communicate with stakeholders, team members. 
  • Problem-Solving: Capacity to address and resolve project challenges creatively and efficiently, maintaining progress and minimizing disruption.
  • Project Management: Experience in supporting the successful upgrade and/or implementation of Core Technology platforms and Enterprise systems for a mid-sized organisation, resulting in process efficiency and user satisfaction. 
  • Requirements Gathering and Analysis: Experience in managing requirements gathering sessions with stakeholders to identify system needs and objectives. Successfully translating these requirements into actionable project plans, ensuring alignment with business goals.
  • Vendor Selection and Management: Experience with RFI/RFP processes for selecting platform vendors, including criteria development and proposal evaluation. Establish and maintain productive relationships with vendors, ensuring adherence to project specifications and timelines.

If you are looking for more information or would like a full copy of the position description, please contact the Talent Acquisition Team on 07 3352 0810 or recruitment@collinsfoods.com.

Please note, the successful applicant/s will be required to undertake pre-employment screening tests which may include a National Police Check and qualifications checks.

CFL is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment where everyone feels they belong. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and as such, all applicants will receive equal consideration for employment for which they qualify, including the option of flexible working arrangements where applicable.

description:
Job Description

BETTER BEGINS HERE

Crown Resorts is a great place to visit and it’s an even better place to work, a place where you can play your part in creating joyful experiences for our guests and our people. We value passion, creativity, and an appetite for change - for the better. Here, you’ll be part of the team, empowered to explore more, experience more and supported by your leader to grow and develop.

The role

We have an exciting opportunity for an experienced Product Manager to join our risk team. This role will be a key subject matter expert for all of our Governance, Risk and Compliance Tools. Key to supporting stakeholders understand business value and manage product releases. You will also be responsible for;

  • Gathering feature requests, co-ordinate implementations and schedule releases.
  • Responsible for managing suite of Archer, Salesforce, Quantexa and Refinitiv.
  • Solve product-related problems, make decisions, complete trade-off analysis to stay on track towards business deliverable commitments
  • Provision and maintenance of access management, including Identifying and assigning employees to the business user groups
  • Participate in operational and interdepartmental teams as a system resource and subject matter expert
  • Act as Project Manager/Project Lead on team projects of a smaller and more specific nature including planning time frames and managing resources

About you

To be successful in this role you will be a GRC tools subject matter expert ideally from an engineering background. You will have strong relationship building skills with he ability to bring senior stakeholders along for the journey.  You will also have;

  • Degree in a relevant field
  • Knowledge of Archer GRC is essential
  • Extensive experience working in product management
  • Experience in building management reporting and visualisations of data using tools such as PowerBI. and project management tools, such as JIRA and Trello
  • Ability to write clear and defined specifications for user stories and features
  • Strong communication, collaboration, and presentation skills to promote product vision and progress
Additional Information

What you can expect from us

On top of exciting career possibilities, we offer better exposure to experiences and learning. To see our range of benefits and opportunities visit Crown Resorts Careers.

Our Crown Community celebrates uniqueness and embraces diversity. We welcome the creativity, insights and experiences from people of different race, age, religion, cultural background, gender, people with disability, people who identify as LGBTIQ+ and Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander; people like you.
teaser: Perfect opportunity for a subject matter expert in risk systems to join our team
title: Product Manager - Risk Systems

description:
Brisbane (preference), OR Sydney 

  • Work in a team that specialises in integration using world-leading technologies across multiple business functions.
  • Multi-cloud, automation environment.
  • Hybrid work model, training opportunities, fantastic team culture.

We’re never just satisfied with how things are – because we know how things could be. And it’s our expert Technology team who forge ahead every day to make those ‘what ifs’ a reality.

Welcome to a place where you can chase real progress and drive real change. And that includes your own career. Being a part of Technology at Suncorp means being switched on, endlessly curious and always adaptable. In return, you’ll be supported to bring your own ideas to the table and challenge conventions – with the aim of making life a little brighter, simpler and better for our customers and each other.

About the role:

This is a fantastic opportunity for an Integration Specialist with experience with either Pentaho, Mulesoft or IBM ACE platforms to work with a leading Australian Insurer. The Suncorp tech environment includes some of the world’s best platforms and latest technologies in addition to a significant presence in the cloud across both AWS and Azure.

As an Integration Specialist, you will champion industry best practice, solutions and technologies, and have superior skills in designing complex innovative platforms and solutions. You will drive the technical vision for complex programs of work and platform architecture and are accountable for ensuring Platform roadmaps are in place and on track for delivery.

Suncorp is dedicated to our enviable culture where you will be supported in your career development, this can include informal and formal training courses; as well as giving you the opportunity to be part of a collaborative team where knowledge is shared.

What you’ll do:

  • Set coding standards and encourage the development teams to follow best practices and minimize technical debt, including considerations for OWASP Top 10 and other secure coding principles
  • Contribute to architectural and solution design decisions, working closely with architects, analysts, developers, testers, and other stakeholders to propose and implement best practice technical solutions
  • Continuous improvement of our CI/CD pipeline; driving automation to reduce cycle time and increase the quality of software delivery across our various tech stacks.
  • Actively involved in implementing Proof of Concept (POCs) and trialling new and emerging integration technologies
  • Liaise with architects, analysts, and developers to ensure that all deliverables are supported by the correct architectural implementation.
  • Contribute and assist the team lead towards development of the backlogs, producing delivery plans as part of backlog of various initiatives.
  • Contributes towards development of robust ways of working, including implementation of Agile practices.
  • Help create an innovative, creative, and fun team culture, capable of developing advanced technologies.

 

What you’ll bring:

  • At least 10 years appropriate industry experience in large enterprise organisation.  
  • Experience in working on Integration Platforms like IBM ACE/MQ, Mulesoft, Pentaho
  • Excellent knowledge/experience in the application of Agile and Lean approaches.
  • Experience with planning, designing, and deploying on-prem and cloud solutions (IaaS, PaaS and SaaS) and deployments, migrations, network, and security frameworks.
  • Experience defining and managing an integration design practice including integration patterns, register, and system integration landscape diagrams.
  • Expertise in deriving solutions that use REST/JSON, SOAP/XML, Java.
  • Strong understanding of application and API security and privacy controls
  • Strong technical knowledge of ETL Capabilities.
  • Experience with Dev Ops and CI/CD tools like Jenkins, Team City etc.
  • Knowledge of multi-tenancy architectures
  • Strong knowledge of system testing, and software quality assurance practices and methodologies as applied to integrated solutions
  • Excellent stakeholder engagement skills with the ability to liaise with other teams and drive delivery using hybrid delivery model.

 

What we can offer you:

  • Discounts and offers on a range of retail favourite stores as well as insurance products.
  • A range of flexible working and leave options, including 20 weeks paid parental leave, 4 weeks paid secondary carer parental leave and unlimited paid emergency response leave.
  • Invest in your brighter future with ongoing study support and career development programs.
  • Give back to our communities with payroll giving, donation matching and paid volunteer leave.
  • Prioritise your work/life balance with our robust employee assistance program and dedicated employee council.

About Suncorp:

We’re proud to be a part of the Suncorp family alongside some of Australia’s most trusted and diverse names in insurance. Together, we share a drive to make the complex simple and bring our customers peace of mind when it matters most – while helping to evolve and innovate the ways we can serve our community every day. That comes with all kinds of exciting opportunities for you to grow your own career. Whether you’re guiding people through life’s biggest moments or providing them with support in times they need it most, you’ll be driven forward by our shared customer obsession and supported at every step of the journey.

For over 100 years Suncorp has been driven by our guiding Purpose – to build futures and protect what matters. To ensure we deliver on that Purpose, we’ve made a commitment, built on trust, empowerment, and flexibility – to help our people unlock their full potential and unleash their best and brightest selves. With the backing and support of some of the most trusted names in insurance, the Suncorp family provides our people with every opportunity to grow their career as they make a meaningful difference for our customers and our communities. We’re excited about what we can achieve together, working every day to be better, do more and realise the future we want to see just beyond the horizon.

If this opportunity sounds like the challenge you have been looking for, please apply online today. 

At Suncorp we build inclusion by providing an environment where everyone can be themselves and feel valued, involved and respected for their perspectives and contribution.

description:
About Capgemini

At Capgemini, we are more than just a business, we are a diverse global collective of strategic and technological experts who are passionate about finding ways technology can help our clients, our people and our communities get the future they want.

Our people are the key to making this vision a reality, which is why we have been recognised by the Australian Workplace Equality Index as LGTBQ+ ‘Employer of the Year’ and ‘Inclusion of Trans and Gender Diverse Employees’ for the past two years. We believe in creating a safe, flexible, and inclusive culture where everyone can bring their authentic selves to work, contributing to our inclusive culture and truly belong, and our staff-led community groups are a testament to this commitment. We are committed to being active allies for everyone.

We believe by combining the power of the latest technology with our human energy, we can drive sustainable thinking into our operations and the work we do with clients. Its why we are committing to being carbon neutral for our own operations no later than 2025 and across our supply chain by 2030, and committed to becoming a net zero business by 2040.

Empower yourself with the knowledge and skills you need to succeed with our access to premier learning platforms, sought-after certifications and boundless development opportunities. You’ll be encouraged to gain at least 40 hours of training each year.

For over 50 years our values and ethics have been at heart of our identity. From our approach to ethics to the way we interact with one another, honesty, boldness, trust, freedom, team spirit, modesty, and fun guide and inspire all we do and have led to us being recognised as one of the World’s Most Ethical Companies by the Ethisphere Institute 10 years in a row.
 
Let’s talk about the team:
 
As a Global SAP partner, Capgemini is one of the world's largest and most experienced SAP systems integrators, with 17,800 practitioners and over 40 years of experience. We support clients to implement highly scalable solutions in Digital Core Transformation, Commerce and LOB Transformation, Advanced Analytics, OnePath for SAP and SAP Innovation.
 
 
Let's talk about the role and responsibilities:  
 
Job responsibilities include working with clients to understand requirements, solutioning, system configuration and documentation.
• Creating / validating process maps
• Configuration, functional specification and test case documentation
• Performing system configuration and Unit Tests
• Execution of test cases
• Providing status and planning input to program leadership 
• Support RFI/RFQ/RFP bids
 
 
Let's talk about your qualifications and experience:    
 

• Minimum of 10+ years professional industry experience
• Excellent Communication skills, ability to run business workshops independently
• Thorough and in depth understanding of Procure to Pay ((Subcontracting, 3PL, Co-packing)
• SAP MM experience required (4 full-cycle implementations)
• SAP SD, LE, WM, PPDS experience a plus
• Deep experience procurement and inventory management
• Strong analytical and communication skills
• Proven track record demonstrating strong communication skills and ability to work in a team environment
• Experience in Manufacturing, Consumer Products, Life Sciences and or Energy sectors
 
Functional resource with experience in Material Management
• Minimum of 5+ years professional industry experience
• Excellent Communication skills, ability to run business workshops independently
• Thorough and in depth understanding of Procure to Pay ((Subcontracting, 3PL, Co-packing)
• SAP MM experience required (2 full-cycle implementations)
• SAP SD, LE, WM, PPDS experience a plus
• Deep experience procurement and inventory management
• Strong analytical and communication skills
• Proven track record demonstrating strong communication skills and ability to work in a team environment
• Experience in Manufacturing, Consumer Products, Life Sciences and or Energy sectors
 
 
 
 
Let's talk about what's in it for you!

Passionate people are Capgemini's Ace of Spades - join us to discover a career that will challenge, support and inspire you. Working at Capgemini you'll find the rewards are more than just financial. You will work alongside some very smart and inspiring people on exciting projects and you will also enjoy incredible benefits. We offer flexible work practices and 40 hours of self-development every year with a huge selection of learning opportunities to choose from.

As "Architects of Positive Futures", Capgemini actively supports the community in 3 ways:

Diversity and Inclusion - we believe diversity of thought fuels excellence and innovation, which is why we positively encourage applications from suitably qualified candidates regardless of their gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, religion, ability, intersex status or age. To support our commitment to diversity and inclusion, we celebrate or recognise special events and days of significance that are important to our employees such as Diwali, Bastille Day, Pride, IDAHOBIT, IWD and International day of people with Disabilities. Our Employee Resource Groups Women@Capgemini, OutFront, Indigeneous, Parents and Careers and Sustainability Community of Practice support the grassroots passion of employees to drive our diversity agenda and effect change.

Digital inclusion - at Capgemini we are using our skills to drive social impact initiatives focusing on helping society address the impact of the digital and automation revolution. We also provide employees with opportunities to give back to the community through charity projects and volunteer days.

Environmental Sustainability - Capgemini joined the CDP's (Carbon Disclosure Project) prestigious "A list" for its commitment to the Net-Zero economy. As well as focusing on helping our clients transform towards more sustainable business models, Capgemini recently announced its commitment to becoming a netzero busines by 2030.

Recognised by Ethisphere as one of the World's Most Ethical Companies for the last 9 years in a row, ethics and values are at the heart of Capgemini's corporate culture and business. Embedded in our DNA, our seven values - Honesty, Boldness, Trust, Team Spirit, Freedom, Fun and Modesty - have remained the same since company inception in 1967. To see how we bring these values to life, visit www.capgemini.com/au-en/careers/ and listen to some of our employee’s stories.

Come join us, bring your whole self to work, create new possibilities for you, your customers and your community and help us to be Architects of Positive Futures.

Please note unsolicited resumes from employment agencies or other third parties will not be considered.

Information Security and Compliance
Capgemini Australia has developed and manages, process orientated Management Systems compliant to the requirements of ISO9001, ISO27001 and ISO14001. We are committed to delivering secure solutions and services through state-of-the-art processes and continual improvement frameworks in line with industry best practices as well as contractual, statutory, and regulatory requirements.
 
#LI-CT

description:
This Federal Government department supports and regulates what is considered a critical industry for everyday Australians.

Due to ongoing technology uplifts, there is an exciting opportunity for a Project-Portfolio Manager to join the Digital PMO Team and oversee a number of projects.

Reporting to the Assistant Director DPMO, the Project-Portfolio Manager will play a key role by providing project assurance to the DPMO for the portfolio of projects that will enable the Digital Group to support the business needs, objectives and strategic objectives.

Key Responsibilities:
  • Oversee the planning, execution, and delivery of a portfolio of Digital and ICT projects and ensure there is a consistent and effective approach to portfolio management and investment planning.
  • Develop and maintain the portfolio roadmap, including project timelines, resource allocation, and budgets.
  • Establish a suitable portfolio structure with an alignment between the outcomes of the projects and the Commission’s business goals.
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business needs and ensure that the portfolio of projects supports the Commission’s strategic and operational objectives and priorities.
  • Provide recommendations for project prioritisation and resource allocation based on strategic and operational alignment and business value.
  • Coordinate and manage interdependencies and allocation of resources between projects within the portfolio to ensure seamless integration and effective delivery.
  • Monitor project progress, identify risks, and implement mitigation strategies to address issues and ensure successful project outcomes.
  • Engage with internal and external stakeholders to gather feedback, address concerns, and ensure effective communication and collaboration throughout the project lifecycle.
  • Guiding stakeholders to develop meaningful and supportive relationships across the Commission.
  • Identify opportunities for process improvement and implement best practices to enhance portfolio management practices and project delivery.
  • Foster a culture of continuous improvement and knowledge sharing within the DPMO.
 Essential Criteria:
  • Extensive experience (typically 5+ years) in portfolio management, project management, or program management within large, complex organisations, preferably in the public sector.
  • Proven track record of managing a portfolio of projects and programs, including successful delivery within scope, time, and budget constraints.
  • Strong understanding of project management methodologies, tools, and best practices, with experience in aligning projects with strategic objectives.
  • Excellent communication, stakeholder management, and leadership skills, with the ability to influence and collaborate effectively across all levels of the Commission.
  • Demonstrated ability to manage resources, budgets, and risks, and to address challenges proactively and strategically.
  • Relevant tertiary qualifications in project management, business administration, information technology, or a related field. Additional certifications in project management (e.g., PMP, PRINCE2) are highly desirable.
What’s on Offer:
  • Contract until 30 June 2025 + a 12 month extension option
  • Iconic industry supported by a notable Federal Government department
  • Flexible working arrangements available
  • Opportunity to obtain an Australian Government Security Clearance
 
Candidates who currently have Baseline Clearance Security Clearances are highly desirable.
Due to the nature of this role, this job is open to Australian Citizens only.
 

Calleo is an equal opportunity employer and we encourage applications from all people including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples.

description:
Product Designer - Sydney or Melbourne (Part-Time)
3 Days Per Week | Office Based | App & Tool Design Projects

About the Role
Our client is seeking a creative and experienced Product Designer to join their team on a part-time basis (3 days per week), working from their Sydney or Melbourne office. This role will involve collaborating across teams to shape the design of digital products and tools, ensuring user-centered designs are at the forefront of development. The successful candidate will play a critical role in driving the design of key features, wireframes, and prototypes, steering the product from concept to implementation.

Key Responsibilities

  • Collaborate closely with Business Analysts and Journey Experts to enhance storyboarding, user flows, and overall customer journeys, using Design Thinking methodologies.
  • Lead the design of wireframes and prototypes for an App, and provide ongoing design oversight to ensure smooth progress from conception to development.
  • Work alongside enterprise architects and full-stack engineers to integrate Product Design requirements during the design phase, ensuring API integration aligns with broader platform objectives.
  • Oversee the design of portfolio views, starting with integrations, and ensure consistency with client needs and strategic direction.
  • Develop the proposed front end of a new wholesale validation tool based on documented requirements.
  • Engage with stakeholders, including divisional leadership, to gather feedback and make necessary design adjustments.

Skills & Experience

  • Proven experience as a Product Designer with a strong portfolio of wireframes, prototypes, and user-centered design projects.
  • Proficiency in storyboarding, user-flow mapping, and creating impactful customer journeys.
  • Strong collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively with business analysts, engineers, and architects to ensure seamless product development.
  • Experience in designing for digital platforms with a focus on front-end development and API integration.
  • Strong attention to detail, with the ability to balance multiple priorities and refine designs based on stakeholder feedback.
  • Excellent communication and problem-solving skills, with a passion for creating innovative, user-centric solutions.
  • Ability to adapt designs based on evolving business requirements and project feedback.

Why This Opportunity?

  • Part-time flexibility (3 days per week) with office-based work in either Sydney or Melbourne.
  • Be part of a dynamic team, shaping high-impact digital products and tools.
  • Opportunity to work closely with cross-functional teams and influence the product's journey from concept to implementation.
  • Play a key role in driving product design initiatives that align with user needs and business goals.

If you're a Product Designer with experience in digital product development and you're looking for a part-time opportunity with a dynamic team, we want to hear from you! Apply now to take the next step in your design career.






Please apply by upload your current resume in Microsoft Word format only (.doc or .docx). If you would like to have a confidential discussion, please contact Ross Townsend on , quoting reference JN -102024-38470. Want to know more about Davidson? Visit us at www.davidsonwp.com

description:
PG Forsta is the leading experience measurement, data analytics, and insights provider for complex industries—a status we earned over decades of deep partnership with clients to help them understand and meet the needs of their key stakeholders. Our earliest roots are in U.S. healthcare –perhaps the most complex of all industries. Today we serve clients around the globe in every industry to help them improve the Human Experiences at the heart of their business. We serve our clients through an unparalleled offering that combines technology, data, and expertise to enable them to pinpoint and prioritize opportunities, accelerate improvement efforts and build lifetime loyalty among their customers and employees.

Like all great companies, our success is a function of our people and our culture. Our employees have world-class talent, a collaborative work ethic, and a passion for the work that have earned us trusted advisor status among the world’s most recognized brands. As a member of the team, you will help us create value for our clients, you will make us better through your contribution to the work and your voice in the process. Ours is a path of learning and continuous improvement; team efforts chart the course for corporate success.

Our Mission:

We empower organizations to deliver the best experiences. With industry expertise and technology, we turn data into insights that drive innovation and action. 

Our Values:

To put Human Experience at the heart of organizations so every person can be seen and understood. 

  • Energize the customer relationship: Our clients are our partners. We make their goals our own, working side by side to turn challenges into solutions. 
  • Success starts with me: Personal ownership fuels collective success. We each play our part and empower our teammates to do the same. 
  • Commit to learning: Every win is a springboard. Every hurdle is a lesson. We use each experience as an opportunity to grow. 
  • Dare to innovate: We challenge the status quo with creativity and innovation as our true north. 
  • Better together: We check our egos at the door. We work together, so we win together. 

 

What We Need:

As a Project Manager, you will play a crucial role in ensuring top-notch project execution for our clients. You will oversee and execute projects and surveys, ensuring they are completed on time and within budget throughout their lifecycle. You will be responsible for building and maintaining strong relationships with our clients, acting as their main point of contact. You will collaborate daily with both internal and external teams, ensuring seamless communication and coordination. You will bring your keen eye for detail to meticulously oversee every aspect of our projects. Your exceptional communication skills will be crucial for seamless interactions with both clients and team members, ensuring our collaborative success.

  • Lead and Coordinate Projects: Take charge of projects from start to finish, setting deadlines, assigning tasks, and ensuring timely progress. Be the main point of contact for clients throughout the project lifecycle.
  • Customer Relationship Management: Develop deep, meaningful relationships with Forsta’s Surveys customers. Understand their needs and provide exceptional service using Forsta products.
  • Communication and Updates: Keep management informed with regular updates on project and account statuses.
  • Business Growth: Identify opportunities to grow the business with existing customers.
  • Comprehensive Project Management: Handle all aspects of customer projects, including proposal writing, execution, and invoicing.
  • Team and Vendor Coordination: Collaborate with internal teams and vendors to support project needs.
  • Daily Interactions: Engage with customers, vendors, and internal departments via phone and email to ensure smooth operations.
  • Key Account Management: Serve as the primary contact for key accounts, providing timely solutions and driving daily business activities.
  • Client Immersion: Deeply understand clients’ businesses, including their challenges, objectives, and industry landscape. Know their business model and what success looks like for them.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor's Degree in a relevant field or an equivalent experience.
  • 3+ years of Market Research or Customer Experience (CX) project management.
  • 4+ years of general project management experience.
  • Experience in Panel Field Management or Advertising is a plus.
  • Previous experience with Forsta Surveys (Decipher) platform is a plus.
  • Account/Project Management experience is a plus.
  • Technical Skills: Familiarity with Salesforce, Teamwork, Jira, and Slack is a plus.
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills.
  • Demonstrated success in outstanding customer service.
  • Ability to develop and maintain long-term business partnerships with clients.
  • Strong multi-tasking and responsibility management skills.

description:
Support Technician

Our story

Sorsix has empowered global health systems and its users to have access to and manage their data and patient information.

Solving human health is our mission, and we are achieving this by creating powerful technologies that streamline and enhance the delivery of healthcare.

By combining our team’s knowledge and experience, as well as harnessing the power of advanced and innovative technology, Sorsix’s vision is in clear sight.

We believe in making healthcare more accessible and instantaneous for everyone around the world, and we won’t stop in achieving this.

Our customers are private and public service providers in Australia, USA, New Zealand as well as the complete digital healthcare system in the countries of Macedonia and Serbia.

 

About the Role

Pinga is highly configurable and its successful deployment for a client depends on the following key factors: excellent understanding of the business domain of the client, successful configuration of the product to fit the client’s needs, and successful support and change request process after go-live.

The primary objective of this position is to become an integral part of our innovative team, supporting and maintaining systems related to our software solutions toward our end users. You will work closely with both the software development and technical support teams to provide assistance in troubleshooting, diagnosing, and resolving software issues. The ideal candidate will possess both software development skills and a strong technical support background.

This role will be based in our Wollongong office.

 

Responsibilities

  • Provide support for the deployment, installation, and maintenance of software systems with users
  • Diagnose and troubleshoot hardware, software, and network issues affecting system performance.
  • Perform system configurations and updates to ensure optimal performance of our computer infrastructure and web technologies.
  • Respond to and resolve technical support requests from users related to system failures, network issues, and software malfunctions.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure timely resolution of technical issues.
  • Support end-users by providing training and guidance on the proper use of software applications and tools.
  • Maintain accurate records of system malfunctions and troubleshooting procedures.
  • Ensure the smooth operation of systems by performing regular maintenance and system health checks.
  • Assist with customer support queries and escalations.

 

Requirements

Provide support for the maintenance of the Pinga platform and the diagnosis and resolution of technical problems:

  • Elaborating customer requirements to provide solutions to problems
  • Responding to customer inquiries about Pinga issues
  • Extending Pinga to meet new, or amended customer requirements
  • Ensuring efficient use through training end-users to solve issues
  • Managing own IDE and local infrastructure
  • Assist with customer support calls and escalations

 

Experience

  • Diploma or equivalent in Engineering, Computer Science or Engineering, Electrical, Mechanical Engineering, Technology Engineering, or a person with a non-engineering background willing to take advantage to start a new career path in the IT sector
  • 2+ years of experience working with clients
  • Written and spoken fluency in English is essential
  • Spoken Macedonian is beneficial (to liaise with office in Skopje)
  • Proficiency in all MS Office applications
  • Ability to work independently and as a team player
  • Strong analytical skills
  • Problem-solving skills
  • Strong communication skills (both written and verbal English)
  • Detail oriented
  • Be a highly motivated change agent 
  • Able to travel to customer sites as required 

 

Skills and abilities

  • Oral comprehension - the ability to listen and understand information and ideas related to the domain
  • Oral expression - the ability to communicate information and ideas so others can understand
  • Written expression - ability to express in writing so others can understand
  • Instructing - ability to train the client, to teach others how to use Pinga (show-how)
  • Problem-solving: to come up with ideas, and solutions about key topics and situations, in order to optimise a workflow or solve an inefficiency problem gap 
  • Problem sensitivity - able to tell/differentiate/escalate/explain when there is a problem
  • Raising the issues and creating awareness of arising problems.

description:
Why Jumbo?
We’re an innovative technology company that has achieved remarkable growth over the past 25 years, from humble beginnings with a single computer to a thriving global technology business. We work with over 13,000 causes globally and have helped raise over $250 million last FY.

Here, innovation isn't a buzzword—it's our way of life. We thrive on pushing boundaries as we seek ways to improve business operations, performance and efficiencies.  Every voice matters, and every idea has the potential to be impactful.

About The Role:
You will be at the forefront of creating innovative mobile application features. Your primary focus will be refining and enhancing iOS applications serving a large customer base. This includes implementing new features, optimising performance, and resolving issues as they arise. You will play a crucial role in maintaining the application’s stability and reliability, ensuring it continues to meet the high expectations of its users.

Collaboration with engineering managers, product managers, designers, and QA engineers will be key to your success in this role, as you work together to prioritise updates and improvements based on user feedback and the company's strategic goals.

On your first day, we'll expect you to have:
  • Experience with Agile methodologies.
  • Passion for user-centric design and a commitment to enhancing user satisfaction through continuous app improvements.
  • Proficiency in Swift, with proven knowledge of Native iOS and the challenges of supporting various iOS devices and versions.
  • Understanding of iOS UI development, including creating views using SwiftUI and UIKit.
  • Experience with RESTful APIs and integration with back-end services.
  • Experience with Git or other version control systems, including conducting and participating in code reviews to ensure code quality and adherence to best practices.
  • Ability to work effectively within a cross-functional team and communicate clearly with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Salary Banding: $120,000 - $150,000 + Super

More about the team
You’ll be joining a cohort of 65 other engineering, data and product professionals who are passionate about building great software and turning ideas into features that customers love.
The open and inclusive culture challenges people to be their best and provides incentives to encourage personal and professional growth. Teams are empowered to design solutions and build features for enterprise-scale customers focused on performance, scalability and security.

Our Ways of Working:
We believe in fostering a healthy work-life balance. Our Brisbane-based hybrid model offers the best of both worlds, collaboration and connection in our office (3 days/week) and the flexibility of working from home (2 days/week). We also embrace flexible working hours with core collaboration times from 10 am-2 pm. This allows you to structure your day around your commitments and preferences, promoting productivity and well-being.

Why join the Jumbo team?
Find Your Freedom At Jumbo Video - https://bit.ly/3mNpy7C
At Jumbo, we're all about ensuring our team thrives, as a valued member, look forward to:
  • An Employee Assistance Program where you can access counselling and coaching sessions to improve your well-being
  • Focus on talent management, including career and skills development
  • An onsite chef (Brisbane) who makes a fresh, gourmet lunch every day
  • Social activities - Lunchtime chess, corporate games, soccer, Friday get-togethers, The Joe Awards, quarterly team days, loads of events to celebrate DEI
We are a 2024 Circle Back Initiative Platinum Employer – we commit to respond to every applicant.
