description:
We are currently seeking applications for a Site Reliability Engineer, to join our client for a period of up to 12 months.

About the opportunity:

The Site Reliability Engineer (SRE) will modernise, transform and deliver a range of sustainable, user-focussed, digital government services for the South Australian community supporting the government’s objectives and goals.  The position will influence strategy and lead system infrastructure to improve the availability, scalability, latency, and efficiency of systems, including hands-on configuration of complex components.  The SRE will provide technical expertise and direction to solve complex problems on infrastructure activities and advise leadership on the infrastructure required to enable delivery of all major digital projects.

About you:

To be successful you will:
  1. Lead and plan systems infrastructure to improve the availability, scalability, latency, and efficiency of all systems, including hands-on configuration of complex components.
  2. Lead an evolving DevOps Tools & enablement strategy by proactively reviewing, developing and implementing strategies, processes and procedures to achieve automation objectives, including implementation of automation tools and frameworks.
  3. Optimise the organisation’s computing architecture by managing the improvement to the design and operation of citizen facing systems to make them more scalable and to increase reliability and more efficiency.
  4. Provide technical expertise to solve complex problems on infrastructure activities and ensure operations are managed and maintained according to service management and security organisation frameworks.
  5. Automate tasks, deployment, and test by creating infrastructure as code, and maintaining the quality of code produced.
  6. Ensure the reliability and performance of critical citizen facing system by developing and implementing strategies to ensure high availability of systems to citizens and agencies that rely on them.
  7. Identify patterns in system performance issues and create strategies and policies to overcome them.
  8. Communicate effectively to leadership and development teams the resulting new policies and oversee the implementation.
  9. Promote team cohesion, productivity, and collaboration, as a leader within Digital Programs, and act as a digital ambassador by supporting the recruitment of highly qualified staff and identifying best practices within the industry.
 About our client:
  • The Office of the Chief Information Officer (OCIO) enables a more connected and secure government so that South Australia Government agencies can better serve our community. They do this by developing and delivering resilient and innovative ICT, digital and cyber security services and critical infrastructure to SA Government agencies that are accessible, trusted and secure.
  • OCIO works within the SA Public Sector Code of Ethics as well as Principles for the division. The OCIO principles are: Customer-centric and Collaborative - They are customer focused, working across the division with, and for our customers to deliver value; Growth Minded - They are adaptable and embrace challenges with an open mind; and, they acknowledge talents and engage with each other to face challenges, embrace different perspectives, and encourage learning; Engaged and Skilled - They  seize opportunities for personal and team growth by leaning in and working together; and, they celebrate each other’s achievements and wins; Honesty in Action - They are committed to building trust internally and with agencies, they do this by acting professionally and with integrity.
  • Their physical work environment is activity-based working, with spaces tailored to areas including, space for focused work, quiet rooms, collaboration spaces, project nooks and general space for everyday work.
  • Work together to ensure South Australia is a thriving, prosperous state now and into the future.
  • Our client is the lead agency for economic, social and financial policy outcomes. They play a vital role in providing financial services to the community and economic and fiscal policy advice to the Government of South Australia.
  • Their culture is one that welcomes all and they embrace flexibility and embrace diversity. They believe people are their most valuable asset, so they work to support the skills, knowledge and capability of their staff.
What our client offers you:
  • Flexible working options
  • Salary packaging options
  • Discounted gym membership
  • Supportive career development opportunities
  • Employee Assistance Program for you and your family
  • Be Well Program
APPLY NOW!
   
Interested candidates, please send your resume (word doc) to sheralee@redwolfrosch.com.au
  
Redwolf + Rosch invite and encourage applications from all backgrounds of gender, disability, culture, and race. If you are a person with a disability and require modifications to the recruitment process, please contact the Recruitment Consultant.

description:
The Role

As a Java Developer with a minimum of 15 years of experience, you’ll work on our in-house package, 'Miles,' an ERP software for automotive finance, leasing, fleet, and mobility management. This end-to-end solution encompasses front, mid, and back-office functions that can be extensively customized to the customers’ needs through configuration and custom development.

You’ll be part of a multidisciplinary team that includes other developers, business consultants, and testers, covering our end-to-end business flow. You can rely on a broad base of knowledge and expertise.

Every team in Sofico works in an agile way, including scrum, daily stand-ups, and backlog refinement. Additionally, you’ll be joining our Java community, which connects all the Software Engineers within Sofico worldwide to share best practices, code, tips, and tricks.

The Right Fit for the Role

A passion for developing and building solutions is at the top of our list. As a Developer, it is also key to keep the bigger picture in mind and understand how different elements are intertwined. Problem-solving is one of your strongest abilities, and you approach it methodically. If you are a team player who enjoys collaborating and sharing knowledge, you’re the perfect blend of technical and soft skills.

This position, based in Sydney, offers a hybrid work model: three days in-office and two days remote. 

Candidates must possess full working rights in Australia; sponsorship is not available.

In your application, elaborate on the following aspects of your career:

  • Experience spanning over 15 years
  • Expertise as either a Full Stack Developer or specialized in Back End development
  • Proficiency in J2EE, SQL/JPA, Hibernate
  • Familiarity with Agile Methodology
  • Exposure to Automotive, Finance, or Leasing industries
  • Experience in Monolithic and Microservices architecture
  • Significance in constructing and deploying solutions, both internally and for clients
  • Engagement in enhancing current applications, developing new modules, or executing customization projects for clients
  • Demonstration of adeptly resolving complex problems in a systematic manner, with project-specific details provided in your application
  • Strong communication skills, including client interaction
  • Fluency in English, given our international and multicultural environment

 About Us

Discover how Sofico empowers businesses in 27 countries worldwide. With offices in Australia, Belgium, France, Germany, Japan, Mexico, the Netherlands, and the UK, our Sydney-based hub manages clients across Australia and Asia.

Our flagship product, Miles, has completed over 60 successful implementations and earned a solid reputation in automotive finance, leasing, fleet, and mobility management. It's an ERP system renowned for its unmatched flexibility.

Sofico operates at the intersection of rapidly transforming industries: automotive, finance, leasing, and IT. This convergence sparks innovation as our clients pioneer new product offerings, focusing on mobility solutions enabled by connected cars.

Join us—a multinational company with over 500 staff—as we lead the way in industry innovation. Unlock new possibilities with Sofico.

What We Offer

At Sofico, we welcome you to an international and multicultural company that has been thriving for over 30 years and is doubling in size every five years. Growth is in our DNA, and we strongly uphold our horizontal and open company culture.

  • Take control of your career with a focus on personal development.
  • Participate in an extensive six-month onboarding program, supported by a dedicated job coach.
  • Enjoy continuous opportunities for learning and professional growth.
  • Work in a modern, state-of-the-art office that's easily accessible.
  • Onsite parking and walking distance from metro.
  • Benefit from a competitive salary, flexible office hours, and hybrid work options.
  • Experience a positive work-life balance with the option to work from home two days a week.
  • Access novated leasing options and mobile phone reimbursement.
  • Enjoy complimentary coffee, soft drinks, breakfast and fruit
  • Participate in team events, including afterwork drinks, BBQs, family days, and company weekends.

If you’re ready to join a dynamic team and take your career to the next level, apply today!

About Us

Discover how Sofico empowers businesses in 27 countries worldwide. With offices in Australia, Belgium, France, Germany, Japan, Mexico, the Netherlands, and the UK, our Sydney-based hub manages clients across Australia and Asia.

Our flagship product, Miles, has completed over 60 successful implementations and earned a solid reputation in automotive finance, leasing, fleet, and mobility management. It's an ERP system renowned for its unmatched flexibility.

Sofico operates at the intersection of rapidly transforming industries: automotive, finance, leasing, and IT. This convergence sparks innovation as our clients pioneer new product offerings, focusing on mobility solutions enabled by connected cars.

Join us—a multinational company with over 500 staff—as we lead the way in industry innovation. Unlock new possibilities with Sofico.

What We Offer

At Sofico, we welcome you to an international and multicultural company that has been thriving for over 30 years and is doubling in size every five years. Growth is in our DNA, and we strongly uphold our horizontal and open company culture.

  • Take control of your career with a focus on personal development.
  • Participate in an extensive six-month onboarding program, supported by a dedicated job coach.
  • Enjoy continuous opportunities for learning and professional growth.
  • Work in a modern, state-of-the-art office that's easily accessible.
  • Onsite parking and walking distance from metro.
  • Benefit from a competitive salary, flexible office hours, and hybrid work options.
  • Experience a positive work-life balance with the option to work from home two days a week.
  • Access novated leasing options and mobile phone reimbursement.
  • Enjoy complimentary coffee, soft drinks, breakfast and fruit
  • Participate in team events, including afterwork drinks, BBQs, family days, and company weekends.

If you’re ready to join a dynamic team and take your career to the next level, apply today!

description:
About the role

Sestra People is seeking a dynamic and experienced Cyber Security Architect. You will play a crucial role in designing, implementing, and maintaining robust security solutions to protect our organisation's critical infrastructure and data. This is an exciting opportunity to contribute to the strategic direction of our cybersecurity initiatives and make a tangible impact on the security posture of our company.

What you'll be doing

  • Develop and implement comprehensive security architectures and strategies to safeguard the organisation's information assets
  • Assess current security posture, identify vulnerabilities, and recommend appropriate mitigation strategies
  • Design and oversee the deployment of security controls, including firewalls, intrusion detection/prevention systems, and access management solutions
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration of security measures into new and existing systems
  • Continuously monitor and analyse security events, implement incident response procedures, and coordinate with relevant stakeholders
  • Stay up-to-date with the latest security trends, technologies, and industry best practices, and recommend innovative solutions to enhance our cybersecurity posture
  • Provide technical leadership, guidance, and mentoring to junior security professionals

What we're looking for

  • Minimum 5 years of experience in a cybersecurity role, with a strong background in security architecture and design
  • Proficiency in designing and implementing security solutions across various domains, including network, application, and cloud security (AWS, Azure, GCP) 
  • Extensive knowledge of security protocols, standards, and industry best practices (e.g. NIST, ISO, OWASP)
  • Proven experience in conducting security assessments, risk analysis, and threat modelling
  • Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills with the ability to think strategically and innovatively
  • Strong understanding of security monitoring, incident response, and forensics
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams
  • Relevant certifications (e.g., CISSP, CISA, CISM) are highly desirable
teaser: Exciting opportunity to lead security architecture and protect critical infrastructure.
title: Cyber Security Architect

description:
At Bakers Delight our vision is to be the most loved bakery in every community.  We've built our business through commitment to the quality of our product, the development of our people and by providing a delightful experience to all of our customers.


The Opportunity

Working in a full-time capacity in this six month contract role, you will report to the Lead Data Engineer and when in the office, be based in our Camberwell support office.  You will be ready to rise to the challenge and “bake” a difference through various activities – always with an eye for continuous improvement - including (but not limited to):

  • Developing and implementing processes for extracting, transforming and loading data (ETL).  
  • Managing data warehouses so that they are all accessible and performing to their optimum. 
  • Setting up systems to ensure quality of data and that data loss and corruption is mitigated.
  • Undertaking performance tuning and data ETL processes. 
  • Ensuring data management processes and systems are documented.
  • Troubleshooting data management system problems. 
  • Analysis of business requirements and project proposals specifically in relation to data components.  
  • Providing technical consultation and expertise to IT experts and other stakeholders. 

Let’s hear about you!

We’d love you to join us!  Your time has come to “bake” a world of difference at Bakers Delight by: 

  • Having previous work experience as a data professional and as a data engineer.  
  • Being degree qualified preferably in Computer Science or related field.
  • Using your expertise in either Python or Scala and SQL. 
  • Having analytical, problem solving and critical thinking skills.
  • Being organised and comfortable multi tasking in a fast-paced work environment. 
  • Being a great communicator with the ability to bridge the gap between technical and business terminology. 

Why Bakers Delight? 

You’ll “loaf” being part of the Bakers Delight family!!  As well as the opportunity to work for a leading and successful international food retailer and well-respected franchisor with bakeries in over 600 locations across Australia, Canada and the USA, Bakers Delight offers a professional, fun and friendly working environment in newly renovated offices.  

You’ll also have access to a range of benefits that aim to support, reward and inspire: 

  • Hybrid work policy 
  • Corporate casual dress environment
  • Free lunch every day
  • Health and wellness activities 

If you have what it “bakes”, and are “bready” for your next challenge, “doughn’t” miss out - apply today!

 

 

Note that we prefer to deal with you directly; we haven’t briefed a recruitment agency on this role and won’t be accepting CVs through any recruitment agency, so please apply directly.

description:
Join Interfi Systems - Where Innovation Meets Financial Services!

At Interfi Systems, we're redefining financial services with modern, scalable solutions for mortgage servicing. Trusted by some of Australia's largest non-bank lenders and emerging ADIs, we are known for our agility, creativity, and ability to stay ahead of the curve. As we continue to grow, we're committed to pushing the boundaries of innovation to meet the evolving needs of our expanding client community.

Role Available: Mid-Level Developer

We’re looking for ambitious, mid-level software developers to join our dynamic feature team! This is an exciting opportunity for a driven professional to make a real impact on our platform. You'll play a key role in:

  • Enhancing our platform with new features.
  • Fixing bugs to ensure a smooth, reliable experience.
  • Driving continuous improvement with your ideas and expertise.
  • Leading the charge in building our next-generation front-end, setting new industry standards.

If you're passionate about creating impactful solutions and want to be part of a team that thrives on innovation, this role is for you!

What We're Looking For:

Essential Skills and Experience:

  • Excellent C# skills
  • Experience with React
  • Experience with REST APIs
  • Ability to analyze and develop features and fixes
  • Proficiency in creating software solutions for real-world problems
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
  • Experience using development IDEs like Visual Studio and SSMS
  • Source control experience, particularly with Git

Bonus Skills and Experience:

  • Exposure to material design
  • Prior knowledge of the finance sector
  • Understanding of CI/CD pipelines
  • Mobile development experience using Ionic and Capacitor

Special Consideration:

Candidates residing in and near Geelong will receive special consideration.

Why Interfi Systems?

We believe in work-life balance and strive to support and encourage our team members. At Interfi, you'll have ownership over your work, and your ideas and opinions will be valued. We offer a comfortable office location in the CBD, close to public transport, shops, food, parks, and even the beach! Our hybrid working model allows for flexibility with work-from-home options.

Our culture is open and forward-thinking, with a focus on providing developers with the best hardware and tools. If you're passionate about what you do and understand the intersection of creativity and business, we want you on our team.

Perks and Benefits:

description:
Who are we?

Standards Australia (SA) is the peak standards development organisation in Australia, with a rich history that dates back to 1922. Currently, we are undergoing a significant transformation and growth phase. In recent years, our workforce has doubled, and we now proudly employ over 300 professionals dedicated to helping shape Australia’s future and fulfilling our mission of empowering communities.

Our organisation brings experts together to create national and international standards that serve as essential guidelines for products and services, ultimately benefiting the Australian community. Our vision is to be a global leader in providing trusted solutions that improve life today and tomorrow.

About the role

The Product Owner will manage product development and deliver roadmap initiatives that will bring products all the way from concept to launch and into lifecycle management. This role will play an integral part in the organisation to manage and maintain overall user experience using applied design thinking, agile and lean practices.

What you'll do
  • Collaborate with a cross-functional team, including Business Owners, Business Analysts (BA), Developers, and other stakeholders, to understand and address key challenges
  • Take ownership of delivering the strategic product direction, supported by clear rationale and robust insights
  • Lead the creation and presentation of key artefacts, including product strategy
  • Work closely with user experience specialists, visual designers, and editors
  • Understand system and platform capabilities, and effectively communicate this information to others
  • Manage communication during solution releases, ensuring stakeholder alignment on development progress, scope, and any obstacles
  • Take ownership of features by embracing the Product Owner role as defined in Standards Australia’s agile methodology
  • Be familiar with agile delivery and provide vision and direction to the development team and other stakeholders throughout the product lifecycle
About you
  • Minimum two years of experience managing digital products
  • Experience working with Project Managers, Business Analysts and Developers
  • Experience working in agile delivery in a Product role
  • Technically fluent skills in digital: social, web, mobile, apps etc
  • A demonstrated track record of working with engineering and UX/UI teams to deliver software
  • Proven experience in scoping and planning projects.
  • Demonstrated stakeholder and relationship management
  • Preferably experienced in Organisation Change Management
  • Display an understanding of the Software Development Life Cycle
  • Strong presentation skills and experience creating features/epics in Jira
  • Strong competency with Roadmap development

Culture & Benefits

Standards Australia is proud to have been awarded the prestigious Employer of Choice Award for two consecutive years, 2023 and 2024. This recognition highlights our commitment to creating an exceptional workplace and fostering a culture of excellence. Our iCARE values form the basis of all we do - Integrity, Courage, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence.

Standards Australia offers many benefits such as flexibility with working from home, regular team events, additional personal/carer’s leave, regular awards, and on-going training. Our award-winning People Perks program includes the following great benefits:
  • Nine-day fortnight – enjoy every second Friday off
  • Parental and secondary carer leave benefits – supporting you and your growing family
  • Workiversary rewards – your commitment and loyalty won’t go unrecognised!
  • Global working – do you have working rights in another country? Enjoy a few weeks of international working every year
  • Early access to long service leave – why wait 10 years for long service leave? 5 years sounds a lot better!
What's next?
 
If Standards Australia sounds like the place for you, please submit your CV outlining your experience and suitability to this role. Eligible applicants must be Australian Citizens, Permanent Residents or have legal rights to work in Australia. Shortlisted applicants will be contacted within 15 business days of their application.

At Standards Australia, we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to fostering a working environment that values diversity, inclusion, and belonging. Our mission is to empower our communities, and in doing so, we strive to create an organisation that genuinely reflects and respects the diversity of the communities we serve; putting people at the heart of all we do. We welcome applications from people of all cultural and linguistic groups, people of all ages and genders, people of Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander background, people with a disability, and people from the LGBTQIA+ community. Should you need any adjustments to be made to our recruitment process, please contact recruitment@standards.org.au

description:
XL Express are a proud privately-owned business specialising in seam-less break bulk transport and logistics solutions, with a comprehensive national network of depots located in all mainland capitals and major regional centres.

At XL Express, our continued success spanning over 30 years of operation, comes from our team of dedicated, passionate and knowledgeable professionals, who all share an unwavering commitment to being a leading partner in seamless distribution and logistics solutions. 

We are proud of our people and consider it an imperative that our entire workforce is encouraged to embrace innovation; that we enable openness and idea sharing and that every employee understands they are regarded as an imperative to our success. 

THE ROLE

We are seeking an experienced IT Support Administrator for a 24-month contracted position to provide comprehensive technical support and system administration services. The role involves maintaining and enhancing IT infrastructure, ensuring efficient operations across various platforms, and managing relationships with external IT providers.

Key Responsibilities:

System Administration:

  • Perform basic server maintenance tasks including managing disk space, ensuring scheduled tasks/cronjobs and services are correct and working.
  • Manage Linux server updates and security patches to maintain system integrity.
  • Administer Active Directory, including user & group management, and group policies.
  • Restore files from backups as required.

Technical Support & General IT Assistance:

  • Provide Level 1 & 2 internal technical support to employees on IT related matters, to resolve user issues promptly and effectively.
  • Request, purchase, and configure new hardware/software.
  • Occasionally provide external technical support to clients or partners as required.
  • Resolve reported issues with Citrix, Windows, Linux, Printers, etc. as they arise.
  • Escalate issues to MSP for Level 3 support, and manage tickets for timely resolution

Network and Infrastructure Management:

  • Troubleshoot network issues to ensure connectivity and operation.
  • Respond promptly to emergencies such as system outages to minimise downtime.

Vendor Management and Account Administration:

  • Manage relationships with approximately 30 vendors to maximise up-time and service efficiency.
  • Audit and approve invoices, collaborating with vendors to rectify discrepancies.
  • Evaluate contracts and agreements to ensure cost-effectiveness from a technical standpoint.

GPS Program and PDT Hardware & OS:

  • Actively manage and update GPS software and hardware, ensuring optimal performance and deployment.
  • Maintain and update PDT (Portable Digital Terminal) hardware and operating systems as required.
  • Manage M2M SIM cards, ensuring acceptable usage and billing.

ABOUT YOU

Qualifications and Experience:

  • Proven experience in system administration, technical support, and network troubleshooting.
  • Familiarity with Linux system updates, Active Directory administration, and server scripting for task automation.
  • Strong communication skills with the ability to interact effectively with stakeholders and external vendors.
  • Ability to work under pressure and respond effectively to emergency situations.
  • Certification in relevant IT disciplines (e.g., Microsoft, Linux) desirable but not required.

ON OFFER

The successful candidate can expect to negotiate a competitive salary commensurate with experience. 

Located at Somerton free on-site parking is available for our employees.

Our team is supportive and friendly, with a shared passion for truly seamless logistics.

 

Learn more about us at xlexpress.com.au or visit us on LinkedIn, Instagram or Facebook!

 

XL Express is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from all suitably qualified candidates.

XL Express maintains a Zero Tolerance Policy to drugs and alcohol in the workplace.

No Agencies please – our fabulous in-house recruitment team have this one covered.

description:
We are looking for an experienced Senior infrastructure Engineer to join our growing IT Team based at our Head Office in Port Adelaide.

About Flinders Port Holdings

Flinders Port Holdings is South Australia's leading Port services group with assets and operations across South Australia. Through integrated stevedoring, infrastructure and logistics services, we connect South Australian businesses to each other and to the world. 

With over 700 employees across the State, we are a diverse and dynamic organisation, committed to delivering the highest quality port and supply chain services.

Role Overview

The Senior Infrastructure Engineer plays a critical role in ensuring the stability, performance, and scalability of the company's key IT services. This role is responsible for the expert IT administration, support, and management of enterprise IT and operational technology systems, as well as datacentre infrastructure. Additionally, the role drives the FPH's transition toward greater cloud adoption and the consolidation of on-premise systems, ensuring the IT infrastructure evolves to meet future demands.

Key Responsibilities

  • Align infrastructure goals with business objectives and managing third-party providers;
  • Support and guide the technical team, promoting cloud adoption, innovation, and continuous improvement;
  • Oversee infrastructure operations, maintenance, and rapid issue resolution for critical platforms;
  • Implement robust backup, disaster recovery, and continuity processes to ensure system resilience;
  • Lead innovation through cloud computing, automation, and the implementation of cybersecurity protocols for risk management; and
  • Deliver key infrastructure projects, collaborate with stakeholders, and monitor performance for process improvements.

About you

Your skills and experience will include;

  • Bachelor of Information Technology or equivalent level of skills and knowledge experience;
  • Expertise in cloud technologies (Azure/AWS), focusing on integration, identity management, cost optimisation, security, and scalable storage;
  • Proven ability to design, manage, and optimise cloud environments while overseeing external service providers for data centre, storage, networking, and cloud services;
  • In-depth knowledge of Microsoft infrastructure (Windows Server, Active Directory, Azure), with experience in cloud migrations and troubleshooting complex technical issues;
  • Extensive experience managing the Microsoft ecosystem (Windows Server, Office 365, Azure) to ensure high availability and optimal performance;
  • Proficient in managing desktop environments and enterprise mobility solutions, ensuring secure, efficient, and reliable end-user technology; and
  • Strong background in cybersecurity, backup, disaster recovery, and enterprise hardware configuration, with the ability to lead cybersecurity initiatives.

Benefits

Flinders Port Holdings know that people are central to everything that we do. A career with us includes:

  • Paid parental leave, up to 16 weeks for primary carers and 8 weeks for non-primary carers including superannuation guarantee on base wages (pro rata for part time employees) whilst on parental leave
  • Ability to purchase an additional 2 weeks of annual leave per annum
  • Up to 8 paid hours per annum to volunteer
  • Up to 3 days per annum of Cultural Leave for First Nations employees
  • $299 annual health and wellbeing subsidy
  • Ongoing professional development opportunities
  • Supportive, motivated and fun team environment
  • An inclusive workplace that fosters diversity
  • Dress for your day office attire
  • Generous Bonus Program
  • Countless opportunities to make change and be involved in exciting projects

To Apply

Even if you don't think you quite meet all the criteria, we'd still love to hear from you. Please click on the link provided to submit your application, ensuring your Resume and Cover Letter outlines your experience and qualifications. 

A pre-employment medical assessment (including drug and alcohol screening) is a requirement of the company, along with ability to hold a MSIC (Maritime Security Identification Card).  Don't worry, if you don't hold an MSIC card, if successful, we will work with you to help you obtain it.  This role requires the incumbent to hold a valid driver's licence.

If you would like to understand more about the role you can email jess.meyer@fphgroup.com.au

Flinders Port Holdings can provide individual accessibility support that may be needed during your interview process. Please let us know of any accommodations that may assist in helping you feel more welcome by contacting our team on the email address above.

At Flinders Port Holdings, we're committed to diversity and inclusion. We encourage applications from all backgrounds, including people with disabilities, all age groups, the LGBTIQA+ community, and culturally diverse backgrounds, including First Nations People. Our team values diverse perspectives, believing that they enhance our work environment and benefit our customers. Join us, and be part of a workplace where everyone belongs.

description:
We are looking for an experienced Senior Network and Operational Technology Engineer to join our growing IT Team based at our Head Office in Port Adelaide.

About Flinders Port Holdings

Flinders Port Holdings is South Australia's leading Port services group with assets and operations across South Australia. Through integrated stevedoring, infrastructure and logistics services, we connect South Australian businesses to each other and to the world. 

With over 700 employees across the State, we are a diverse and dynamic organisation, committed to delivering the highest quality port and supply chain services.

Role Overview

The Senior Network Operational Technology Engineer is responsible for designing, implementing, and managing the organisation's network infrastructure. The position ensures the stability, security, and performance of the network, while leading strategic network projects, troubleshooting complex issues, and mentoring junior engineers. Additionally, the Senior Network and Operational Technology Engineer plays a pivotal role in integrating Operational Technology (OT) systems, ensuring seamless network and OT operations across the enterprise.

Key Responsibilities

  • Design, implement, and manage scalable, secure, and highly available network solutions that meet business needs;
  • Continuously monitor and maintain network systems for optimal performance, addressing issues proactively;
  • Conduct regular network upgrades to improve efficiency, capacity, and security, ensuring compliance with security policies;
  • Collaborate with the Cyber Security team to implement robust security measures, protecting the network from threats;
  • Provide advanced technical support, resolving incidents and outages, analysing root causes, and improving network services; and
  • Manage external vendor relationships, maintain accurate documentation, and align network solutions with business needs through stakeholder collaboration.

About you

Your skills and experience will include;

  • Bachelor of Information Technology or equivalent level of skills and knowledge gained through experience;
  • Extensive network engineering experience with expertise in Cisco routers, switches, site commissioning, and fault-finding;
  • Strong knowledge of network security protocols, including firewalls, VPNs, NAC, IDS/IPS, and advanced routing protocols (BGP, OSPF, EIGRP, MPLS);
  • Proficient in designing and managing complex network architectures (LAN, WAN, WLAN, data centres) with a focus on high availability, disaster recovery, scalability, and network virtualisation;
  • Hands-on experience with wireless networks (5G, LTE), cloud environments (AWS, Azure, GCP), and VoIP deployment, with expertise in QoS management and disaster recovery;
  • Relevant certifications (CCNA, CCNP, CCIE) are highly desirable, along with strong analytical and communication skills and vendor management; and
  • Ability to work independently or collaboratively, with a customer-focused mindset and a commitment to staying updated on the latest technology trends.

Benefits

Flinders Port Holdings know that people are central to everything that we do. A career with us includes:

  • Paid parental leave, up to 16 weeks for primary carers and 8 weeks for non-primary carers including superannuation guarantee on base wages (pro rata for part time employees) whilst on parental leave
  • Ability to purchase an additional 2 weeks of annual leave per annum

  • Ongoing professional development opportunities
  • Supportive, motivated and fun team environment
  • An inclusive workplace that fosters diversity
  • Dress for your day office attire
  • Generous Bonus Program
  • Countless opportunities to make change and be involved in exciting projects

To Apply

Even if you don't think you quite meet all the criteria, we'd still love to hear from you. Please click on the link provided to submit your application, ensuring your Resume and Cover Letter outlines your experience and qualifications. 

A pre-employment medical assessment (including drug and alcohol screening) is a requirement of the company, along with ability to hold a MSIC (Maritime Security Identification Card).  Don't worry, if you don't hold an MSIC card, if successful, we will work with you to help you obtain it.  This role requires the incumbent to hold a valid driver's licence.

description:
About the Role
We are seeking an experienced and dynamic EL2 Enterprise Architect to join our team on a Labour Hire basis. This key position will provide critical support in resolving issues, managing risks, and delivering high-quality enterprise architecture solutions aligned with organizational priorities.

The ideal candidate will have strong technical and business expertise, and the ability to work independently while overseeing complex and sensitive projects that have significant strategic or operational importance.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Develop and deliver a high-quality enterprise architecture aligned with corporate objectives.
  • Align business solutions with organizational goals and priorities.
  • Ensure compliance with architecture models, methodologies, and standards.
  • Engage with stakeholders to understand both tactical and strategic objectives.
  • Provide technical oversight and resolve complex issues during project planning and delivery.
  • Deliver coherent technical business solutions across the organization.
  • Represent architectural solutions in governance processes, including the Architecture Review Board (ARB).
  • Operate within the approval framework for architecture compliance.

Essential Skills & Experience:

  • Strong communication and stakeholder management skills.
  • Extensive technical and business architecture background, delivering enterprise and business solutions.
  • Ability to balance organizational goals, project objectives, and strategic drivers.
  • Experience in translating business capabilities into technical requirements.
  • Proven ability to work across both business and ICT functions.

Desirable Skills:

  • Minimum 10 years of architecture experience.
  • Industry experience in financial, health, or insurance sectors.
  • Proven experience in developing business solutions aligned to specific subject areas.
  • TOGAF certification or equivalent IT architectural qualification.
  • Experience working in both Agile and Structured delivery environments.

Apply Now!
This is an exciting opportunity for a highly motivated architect to make a meaningful impact in a large, complex organization. If you thrive in fast-paced environments and enjoy solving complex technical challenges, we'd love to hear from you.

Consultant

description:
We are looking for an experienced Network and Operational Technical Manager to join our growing Information Technology team based at our Head Office in Port Adelaide.

About Flinders Port Holdings

Flinders Port Holdings is South Australia's leading Port services group with assets and operations across South Australia. Through integrated stevedoring, infrastructure and logistics services, we connect South Australian businesses to each other and to the world. 

With over 700 employees across the State, we are a diverse and dynamic organisation, committed to delivering the highest quality port and supply chain services.

Role Overview

The Network and Operational Technology Manager plays a crucial role in designing, implementing, and managing the organisation's network infrastructure. The Network and Operational Technology Manager is responsible for ensuring the stability, security, and performance of the network, as well as leading network projects, troubleshooting complex issues, and mentoring engineers.

Key Responsibilities

  • Lead, mentor, and manage network engineers and operational technology staff;
  • Design, implement, and manage secure, scalable network solutions that meet business needs;
  • Continuously monitor and maintain network systems for optimal performance, addressing issues proactively;
  • Perform regular network upgrades to enhance efficiency, capacity, and security, ensuring compliance with security policies;
  • Collaborate with the Cyber Security team to strengthen network security and protect against threats; and
  • Provide advanced technical support, resolve incidents, and maintain network documentation while managing vendor relationships and internal collaboration.

About you

Your skills and experience will include;

  • Bachelor of Information Technology or equivalent level of skills and experience gained through experience;
  • Significant technical experience in network engineering, particularly in Operational Technology environments (industrial/mining/energy/maritime industries);
  • Expertise in designing, implementing, and managing complex enterprise-scale networks, including network segmentation, redundancy, and failover strategies;
  • Proficient in networking hardware, Layer 2/3 switching, routing protocols (BGP, OSPF, MPLS), and network security (firewalls, VPNs, NAC, IDS/IPS);
  • Hands-on experience with Cisco IOS, network virtualisation (SDN), wireless technologies (5G, LTE), and cloud networking (AWS, Azure);
  • ITIL/ITSM knowledge, relevant certifications (CCNA, CCNP, CCIE), and a commitment to continuous learning in new technologies and solutions.

Benefits

Flinders Port Holdings know that people are central to everything that we do. A career with us includes:

  • Paid parental leave, up to 16 weeks for primary carers and 8 weeks for non-primary carers including superannuation guarantee on base wages (pro rata for part time employees) whilst on parental leave
  • Ability to purchase an additional 2 weeks of annual leave per annum
  • Up to 8 paid hours per annum to volunteer
  • Up to 3 days per annum of Cultural Leave for First Nations employees
  • $299 annual health and wellbeing subsidy
  • Ongoing professional development opportunities
  • Supportive, motivated and fun team environment
  • An inclusive workplace that fosters diversity
  • Dress for your day office attire
  • Generous bonus program
  • Countless opportunities to make change and be involved in exciting projects

To Apply

Even if you don't think you quite meet all the criteria, we'd still love to hear from you. Please click on the link provided to submit your application, ensuring your Resume and Cover Letter outlines your experience and qualifications. 

A pre-employment medical assessment (including drug and alcohol screening) is a requirement of the company, along with ability to hold a MSIC (Maritime Security Identification Card).  Don't worry, if you don't hold an MSIC card, if successful, we will work with you to help you obtain it.  This role requires the incumbent to hold a valid driver's licence.

If you would like to understand more about the role you can email jess.meyer@fphgroup.com.au

Flinders Port Holdings can provide individual accessibility support that may be needed during your interview process. Please let us know of any accommodations that may assist in helping you feel more welcome by contacting our team on the email address above.

At Flinders Port Holdings, we're committed to diversity and inclusion. We encourage applications from all backgrounds, including people with disabilities, all age groups, the LGBTIQA+ community, and culturally diverse backgrounds, including First Nations People. Our team values diverse perspectives, believing that they enhance our work environment and benefit our customers. Join us, and be part of a workplace where everyone belongs.

description:
Employment Opportunity

Information Division is seeking an experienced Test Manager to lead our Testing Centre of Excellence (COE). The Capability Delivery Branch is responsible for delivering ICT products, including business applications, commercial off-the-shelf solutions, and infrastructure projects. Our testing team is vital in providing support across both project and sustainment activities.

As the Test Manager you will lead test management activities across projects and BAU sustainment activities, ensuring that all testing efforts are aligned with best practice. This role involves managing the test team, offering guidance, training, and support for their testing activities. You will oversee testing resources to ensure adequate test coverage for both projects and sustainment activities.

In this role, you will establish testing frameworks, strategies, and automated test suites, leveraging your expertise in automated testing to build the teams capabilities. You will focus on building an automated testing capability based on best practices, with an initial focus on automating regression testing to reduce manual testing efforts. Additionally, you will up-skill the testing team to ensure they are equipped to implement and maintain these automated testing solutions.

You will work closely with directors and multi-disciplinary teams to deliver various software development projects, including Microsoft Dynamics CRM and Portal technologies. You may have a hands-on testing role for critical work programs, in this you will also maintain the test suite in Azure DevOps while ensuring adherence to established testing standards.

We operate in a fast-paced environment and seek an enthusiastic and detail-oriented Test Manager. A strong background in a Test Manager role along with hands on experience in manual and automated testing is a must.

The successful candidate will demonstrate the ability to plan and execute tests based on business and technical requirements, ensuring comprehensive coverage that meets digital service standards, accessibility, and usability guidelines. 

How you can help us make a difference

The successful candidate must demonstrate strong leadership and analytical skills, attention to detail and the ability to work in a fast-paced environment. You must have hands-on experience in test automation development. Our ideal candidate will have experience as a Test Manager in ICT projects, with a proven track record of contributing to the delivery of project outcomes on time and within budget. You will possess well-developed communication skills and the ability to work both independently and collaboratively within multi-disciplinary teams. 

The successful candidate should have skills and experience in:

  • Establishing an automation testing capability within an organisation, including tool selection and implementation.
  • Leading and empowering a team of testers, providing mentoring and ensuring quality control in testing processes.
  • Developing divisional testing strategies to support both project initiatives and business-as-usual (BAU) programs of work.
  • Strong understanding of testing methodologies and proficiency in using test tools such as Azure DevOps, combined with a comprehensive understanding of the software development life cycle and the critical role of testing in successful project delivery.
  • Hands-on experience in both manual and automated testing using COTS automation tools such as Tosca.
  • Leading various types of testing, including System, Integration, Regression, Performance, and User Acceptance Testing (UAT).
  • Understanding the Digital Service Standard and being familiar with Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG)
  • Stakeholder relationship-management and communication skills, capable of engaging with all stakeholders including senior leadership, customers, vendors, and technical stakeholders, with the ability to translate complex technical concepts into clear, non-technical business language.

﻿Qualifications and Work Experience:

A minimum of 3 years of experience in a Test Manager role, overseeing testing teams responsible for system and integration testing for large-scale systems using both manual and automated testing methods. 

Please note: Salaries in the department are provided through its Enterprise Agreement. Additional remuneration may also be provided through Individual Flexibility Arrangements (IFA). These IFAs can be negotiated prior to commencement.

description:
Employment Opportunity

Information Division is seeking a highly qualified Software Developer to take on technical responsibilities through all stages and iterations of software development lifecycle. This recruitment may be used to fill roles within either the Capability Development or Application Sustainment teams, depending on the candidate's skills and experience.

Information Division supports various internal and external CRM systems (both on-premises and cloud-based), including Dynamics 365 and Microsoft Power Platforms. Our Capability Development Section delivers projects that enhance existing CRM solutions and build new products using these technologies.

The Capability Sustainment team is responsible for maintaining and supporting current CRM products.

The ideal candidate will have a proven track record in developing cloud-native SaaS solutions using Power Apps and Dynamics 365. This role requires expertise in customising and configuring Dynamics 365 solutions, both on-premises and online, as well as integrating Dynamics systems with bespoke systems.

In this role, you will work within a low-code/no-code environment while demonstrating proficiency in C# .NET development to create and maintain custom plugins, workflows, and web resources. You will contribute to both maintaining existing systems and developing new solutions as part of various projects. The successful candidate must demonstrate the ability to plan and drive software development activities while applying appropriate development methods, tools, and techniques.

As a senior member of the development team you will be expected to contribute to the development of policies, standards, frameworks, and guidelines that support software development and uplift to the cloud. Additionally, you will mentor junior developers, helping them develop practical skills in their roles.

How you can help us make a difference

Our ideal candidate must demonstrate strong expertise in CRM and Dynamic 365, including experience in developing end to end solutions that meet business requirements. They must also have experience integrating with commercial off-the-shelf products and bespoke systems and applications. In a senior developer role, you will provide guidance and mentorship to junior developers and cadets, participate in peer reviews to ensure adherence to standards and contribute to the Development Centre of excellence to improve processes and standards. 

The successful candidate must have in-depth knowledge and experience in the following: 

  • Dynamics 365 CRM customisation (both premise and online); including plugins, JavaScript, workflows, custom web resources, PCF control
  • Dynamics 365 CRM security and administration
  • Integration with Dynamics 365 CRM using Power Automate, Azure Function App, Web App, Service Bus and General Azure knowledge
  • General .net and C# skills
  • Experience with agile delivery and the use of Azure DevOps
  • Troubleshooting and incident resolution 
  • Microsoft Power Platform 
  • Application of ISM controls in a protected environment
  • Power BI Dashboards and reports (desirable) 

Qualifications and work experience

  • Minimum of 5 years experience as a developer in Dynamics 365 environment
  • Degree in software engineering or related field is highly desirable

﻿Please note: Salaries in the department are provided through its Enterprise Agreement. Additional remuneration may also be provided through Individual Flexibility Arrangements (IFA). These IFAs can be negotiated prior to commencement.

description:

description:
Project Manager for Digital and Software Based Projects. Daily rate contract with government org.

Your new company

An opportunity is available for a Project Manager with experience in the delivery of software-based, digital projects, to join a state government organisation on a daily contract until June 2025. This role is ideal for someone who has worked within a Microsoft environment and has managed a variety of small to medium-sized projects and has great vendor management experience.

Your new role

You will lead and manage the delivery, risk and quality of projects, ensuring projects are completed on time, on budget, to quality standards, and within an agreed scope. The role is responsible for the project management methodologies including waterfall and agile frameworks as deemed appropriate to meet the projects' deliverables.

As an IT Project Manager, you will lead a broad range of projects, primarily software-based, including Microsoft-related software development, digital transformation, and AI projects. You will also oversee vendor management, ensuring they are on track and coordinating with relevant stakeholders from the client. Your expertise will drive streamlined communication, efficient information sharing, and improved project outcomes.


What you'll need to succeed

  • Proven experience in project management, with a successful track record of delivering software development projects on time and within budget.
  • Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills
  • Proficiency in project management tools and methodologies (Agile).
  • Project management certification (PMP, Prince2, Agile) is a plus.
  • Experience in software development projects, particularly with Microsoft technologies.
  • Ability to manage vendor relationships and ensure project milestones are met.
  • Experience within government environments preferred


What you'll get in return

Join a government organisation offering a contract until June 2025, hybrid working, and an in-house development team working on exciting digital projects like AI.

What you need to do now




If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now.

If this job isn't quite right for you, but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.

description:
About LEAP Dev
LEAP Dev is the “Software House” powering LEAP Legal Software, the leading provider of Legal Practice Productivity Solutions in the world. We’re part of ATI Global – one of the largest international LegalTech companies. For more than 30 years, our curiosity and commitment to continual improvement has kept us reimagining productivity tools for lawyers and their staff to support our guiding purpose, to ‘Help lawyers who help people’. The market leading software we develop and support is used by more than 100,000 lawyers and their staff in small and medium sized law firms.

Working alongside our team of passionate high achievers, you’ll join a fast-growing technology business where things seldom stay the same for long. With more than 1000 smart, caring and ambitious ‘LEAPsters’ working together across Australia, Canada, the United States, the United Kingdom, the Republic of Ireland, Poland and New Zealand, you’ll find yourself in good company here.

What you'll do
As the newest Mid Level .NET Developer you'll join our content team which maintains and develops our content development and distribution system. This is a 100% backend development role which will see your time split between fixes, improvements and feature development. You'll work closely with the Frontend team and Team Manager on deciding what features to build, break down and build features with the team, review code, complete unit tests, ensure operational excellence, and share knowledge broadly across the engineering organisation. Your day-to-day might include:
  • Designing, coding and testing software components
  • Utilising Amazon Web Services to build secure, scalable and highly available solutions
  • Unit testing
  • Working with users and other stakeholders to define and clarify requirements
What you'll bring
You are a focused motivated and hard-working developer who wants to join a fantastic growing team at a critical time and learn on the job to expand your skills. In addition to that you will bring:
  • 4+ years commercial C# development experience including recent versions of ASP.NET Web API
  • Strong knowledge of SOLID principles
  • Experience with AWS Services (S3, Lambdas, Dynamo, Athena etc.)
  • Experience with MS SQL, understanding relational DB design, ability to write complex SQL queries.
  • You are not allergic to web front-end development!
  • A positive attitude – things might not always go as expected but we maintain optimism and win, nonetheless
  • The ability to think out of the box – not all our tasks are standard so neither are the solutions
  • You are a team player – we reach our goals together and help each other to succeed
LEAP is an inclusive, people-first company committed to breaking down institutional barriers that keep people from reaching their potential. If you meet some, but not all of the requirements above, we encourage you to still submit your application.

Why join LEAP Dev?
  • We build and develop a market leading, “Legal Tech” product, with offices in Australia, New Zealand, United States, Canada, United Kingdom and the Republic of Ireland.
  • We are committed to innovation and global expansion of our products and are constantly utilising new technologies to better our client experience.
  • Our hybrid work environment offers the best of both worlds, whether you prefer to be in the office or work from home you have the flexibility to work however suits you and your team.
  • We encourage our employees to have a voice and to collaborate with each other to work on technical solutions, of course we have company visions and goals, but we want you to help us achieve these!
  • We will invest our time and money in you to help develop your career. Open discussions and reviews will help us understand your career aspirations, maybe it’s a new AWS certification you are after or an internal move to a new area, we will support you and your goals
  • As a LEAP Dev employee, you will receive a competitive salary, paid learning and development opportunities, free platinum gym membership, generous parental leave benefits, an additional paid wellbeing day, social events and MUCH MORE!

description:
• Employment Type: full time continuing role as a Cyber Security Controls Assurance Manager
  • Excellent salary package including superannuation
  • Location: UNSW Kensington Campus (Hybrid Working Opportunities)

About UNSW:
UNSW isn’t like other places you’ve worked. Yes, we’re a large organisation with a diverse and talented community, a community doing extraordinary things. Together, we are driven to be thoughtful, practical, and purposeful in all we do. Taking this combined approach is what makes our work matter. If you want a career where you can thrive, be challenged and do meaningful work, you’re in the right place.

The Cyber Security Controls Assurance Manager is responsible for overseeing and advancing the University’s cyber security controls assurance practices, ensuring that cyber security controls are effective, regularly tested, and continuously improved. Key responsibilities include developing and executing strategies for cyber security controls testing, facilitating the remediation of identified gaps, and delivery of cyber security metrics and reporting to support senior management decision-making The Cyber Security Controls Assurance Manager reports to the Head of Cyber Security Governance & Assurance and has direct reports.

Accountabilities:

  • Lead the strategic planning, execution, and continuous improvement of cyber security controls assurance testing, including regular controls effectiveness testing and gap assessments.
  • Develop and implement a continuous controls assurance testing strategy, with a focus on control monitoring, automation, uplift, and rationalisation.
  • Oversee and deliver annual controls assurance testing activities, including penetration testing, application security assessments, and red teaming exercises.
  • Facilitate post-testing assurance by reviewing findings, advising stakeholders, prioritising remediation efforts, and managing closure of actions.
  • Monitor, track, and ensure timely closure of findings, risks, and associated actions resulting from controls assurance activities, ensuring alignment with the University’s risk appetite.
  • Develop, collect, and continuously improve cyber security metrics and Key Risk Indicators (KRIs)/Key Control Indicators (KCIs) to measure performance and risk exposure.
  • Lead the delivery and management of periodic cyber security metrics reporting.
  • Present insights, information, and recommendations to leadership and stakeholders to inform decision-making and support organizational objectives, and present at quarterly GRC Community of Practice (CoP) and Developer Security CoP meetings to foster collaboration and knowledge sharing across faculties and divisions.
  • Update and maintain the cyber security risk register with findings from testing, assessments, and performance metrics, ensuring that risks are tracked and mitigated.
  • Manage audit assurance activities by providing leadership in facilitating the remediation of audit findings, ensuring that identified risks are mitigated in accordance with agreed timelines and corrective actions are successfully implemented.
  • Lead the maturity and management of Cloud Security Posture Management (CSPM) tools, including tuning, ongoing monitoring, and remediation activities.
  • Manage the delivery of expert-level source code reviews, including the integration of applications and repositories with security scanning tools like CXOne.
  • Oversee the management of Checkmarx, ensuring the platform is effectively utilised for source code security scanning and application security assurance.
  • Oversee crowdsourced security testing / bug bounty programs, ensuring these programs are aligned with security objectives and contribute to continuous improvement in security posture.
  • Provide strategic cyber security consulting and advisory services to the Cyber Security Enablement Program and other key initiatives across the University, ensuring alignment with governance and compliance standards.
  • Manage and mentor a team, providing guidance, support, and professional development opportunities to ensure high performance and continuous growth.
  • Align with and actively demonstrate the Code of Conduct and Values
  • Cooperate with all health and safety policies and procedures of the university and take all reasonable care to ensure that your actions or omissions do not impact on the psychosocial or physical health and safety of yourself or others.
  • Ensure hazards and risks psychosocial and physical are identified and controlled for tasks, projects, and activities that pose a health and safety risk within your area of responsibility.

Skills and Experience:

  • Extensive management expertise and supporting experience (7+ years) in cyber security controls assurance, with a proven track record in controls assurance testing, metrics reporting, and audit management.
  • Strong experience with cyber security assurance tools such as Checkmarx, Lacework, BugCrowd, and similar platforms.
  • Certifications such as CISSP, CISM, CRISC, CEH, or relevant certifications in security assurance and controls testing are highly desirable.
  • Demonstrated experience in leading penetration testing, red teaming, application security assessments, and cloud security posture management.
  • Strong understanding of cyber security metrics, KRIs/KCIs, and their role in managing and communicating risk.
  • Experience in working with risk registers and driving the remediation of risks and audit findings.
  • Excellent communication, interpersonal, and leadership skills, with a proven ability to influence and engage stakeholders across all levels.
  • Strong project management skills, with the ability to manage multiple initiatives simultaneously while maintaining a focus on quality and timelines.
  • High level of motivation, resilience, and the ability to work both independently and as part of a collaborative team.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to present complex information clearly and concisely to diverse audiences.
  • An understanding of and commitment to UNSW’s aims, objectives and values in action, together with relevant policies and guidelines.
  • Knowledge of health & safety (psychosocial and physical) responsibilities and commitment to attending relevant health and safety training.

To Apply: If this is of interest to you, please submit your CV, Cover Letter and responses to the Skills and Experience outlined above and in the position description.

More Information: visit https://www.jobs.unsw.edu.au/

Contact

Jen MacLachlan, email: j.maclachlan@unsw.edu.au

Applications close: Monday 28th of October at 11.30pm

Benefits and Culture

  • Flexible hybrid working
  • Additional 3 days of leave over the Christmas Period
  • Access to lifelong learning and career development
  • Progressive HR practices
  • Discounts and entitlements 

UNSW is committed to equity diversity and inclusion. Applications from women, people of culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds, those living with disabilities, members of the LGBTIQ+ community; and people of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander descent, are encouraged. UNSW provides workplace adjustments for people with disability, and access to flexible work options for eligible staff.

The University reserves the right not to proceed with any appointment.

title: Cyber Security Controls Assurance Manager

description:
Gallagher Bassett (GB) is Australia and New Zealand’s premier third party claims administrator. We manage claims on behalf of insurers, brokers, government bodies and self-insured organisations. We are part of the leading global risk management and insurance group Arthur J Gallagher & Co.

 

Life at GB is an adventure - often fast paced, unpredictable, challenging and deeply rewarding. It is social and engaging, with our unique and positive culture underpinned by The Gallagher Way – values lived daily by our people.

 

In addition to flexible working options, we also offer supportive learning and career pathways and provide ongoing access to training and career development. We invest in our people through strong succession planning and have a number of mentoring and training programs available.

There are some great things happening at GB and, we want YOU to be a part of it all!

 

As we expand further in the NSW workers compensation scheme, we are offering a unique opportunity for an experienced candidate to partner with claims teams to undertake quality assurance and promote best practice across the function.

 

Reporting to the Manager, Claims Excellence and Strategy, this role will see you analyse data and provide valuable insights to support strategic decision-making and drive improvements in workers compensation processes. You will work closely with cross-functional teams, including Operations Claims, Operations Technical, Data & Insights, Learning & Capability, Quality Assurance, Customer Experience and Project Manager to gather and interpret data, identify trends and patterns, and develop actionable recommendations for Continuous Improvement projects. The ideal candidate will have a strong analytical mindset, excellent problem-solving skills, and a deep understanding of workers compensation regulations and processes.

 


Responsibilities
  • Work closely with cross-functional teams to understand business objectives and develop service design improvement solutions for the business;
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to define business requirements and ensure data accuracy and integrity;
  • Conduct market research and competitive analysis to identify industry trends and best practices in workers compensation;
  • Provide recommendations based on data analysis to drive improvements in workers compensation processes and outcomes;
  • Support the development and implementation of data-driven strategies and initiatives to reduce costs, meet legislative requirements and improve outcomes;
  • Facilitate harvesting or improvement ideas from within our business ensuring they are captured and prioritised based on potential for performance uplift/benefit. 

Qualifications
  1. Proven experience as a Business Analyst or similar role in the workers compensation field;
  2. Strong analytical skills and the ability to interpret complex data sets related to workers compensation claims;
  3. Proficiency in data analysis tools and software (e.g., Excel, SQL, Tableau, Power BI);
  4. Excellent problem-solving and critical-thinking abilities;
  5. Strong communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively communicate complex information to stakeholders;
  6. Deep understanding of workers compensation regulations, processes, and best practices;
  7. Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders in the workers compensation field;
  8. Attention to detail and the ability to manage multiple projects and priorities.
