description:
End User Computer Engineer 

Level 2 IT Support 

 

Awaiting Benefits 

  • Exciting career development and progression opportunities 
  • Paid certifications and training 
  • Birthday leave – take your birthday off every year! 

 

The Company 

Our client is a boutique IT Security & Compliance Financial Services specialist founded in 2002. They protect finance companies from ever-increasing security threats and regulatory shifts, and leverage the power of technology to drive business success. Their elite team of specialists deliver tailored IT solutions that meet the unique needs of the Financial Services Industry. 

Due to growth, we are looking for an experienced End User Computer Engineer to join their growing team based in George Street, Sydney. 

 

The Role 

The End User Computer Engineer will be responsible for managing and supporting the end user computing environment, including desktops, laptops, mobile devices, printers, and peripherals. This role is also responsible for managing and supporting cloud systems and applications provided to end users for productivity, security or compliance.  

Responsibilities 

  • Provide 1st and 2nd level end user support to PCs and Macs including Line of Business Applications and peripheral support via phone, email, on site and remote support tools 
  • Provide system administration and support of Active Directory, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Entra ID and Microsoft Intune 
  • Ensure all devices are patched for vulnerabilities and meet all compliance requirements 
  • Monitor and manage security and system alerts from SIEM and action and escalate as required 
  • Consult with vendors and other third parties to arrange repair of faulty equipment or restoration of service 
  • Log, action and resolve service requests via ConnectWise PSA so that the client and other technicians can understand or assist 
  • Ensure response and resolution targets are met while owning the issue and escalating appropriately 
  • Adhere to change control, compliance, operational and security procedures 
  • Perform desktop and laptop builds with SOE using deployment tools and Intune 
  • Provide end user training for new starters and system upgrades (e.g. hardware, Microsoft 365 productivity or security applications)  
  • Assist with client security and compliance audits and systems to align to the company and clients with industry best practise 
  • Undertake project work and be responsible for timely and accurate delivery 
  • Create and maintain system and application documentation 
  • This role requires some onsite presence at client sites 

 

Skills and Experience 

  • 3 years working in an MSP/MSSP 
  • Certifications in Microsoft Products (MS-100, AZ-104), ConnectWise, Sophos 
  • Experience working in highly IT compliant organisations using frameworks such as ITIL and ISO27001 
  • A desire to be challenged whilst working with the latest technology to deliver exceptional outcomes 
  • Demonstrated excellent analytical and problem-solving ability 
  • Proven experience delivering outstanding customer service to all levels of end users 
  • Impeccable communication skills (written and verbal) and confidence in front of all levels of client staff 
  • A strong work ethic, a passion for information technology and a drive to continuously learn 
  • Commitment to delivering the right solution the first time within specified time limits 
  • Strong responsibility and accountability with the ability to manage multiple tasks to challenging deadlines and adapt to changing priorities 
  • Ability to work autonomously and effectively with staff whether on site or remote 

 

This role is a fantastic opportunity to further develop your technical skills and progress to the next level. A great team environment, competitive salary and other benefits are on offer for the successful candidate! Apply today, and shortlisted candidates will be contacted immediately.

description:
SS&C is a global provider of investment and financial services and software for the financial services and healthcare industries. Named to Fortune 1000 list as top U.S. company based on revenue, SS&C is headquartered in Windsor, Connecticut and has 20,000+ employees in over 90 offices in 35 countries. Some 18,000 financial services and healthcare organizations, from the world's largest institutions to local firms, manage and account for their investments using SS&C's products and services.

Job Description

Overview

SS&C is the largest global investor service provider, servicing more than 55 million investors. Continually investing in global technology and services across the spectrum of distribution channels including Asset Managers, Financial Advisors, Wealth Managers and large financial institutions such as Banks and Insurers. Investor servicing is offered in many countries, including the U.S., Canada, the U.K., Ireland, Luxembourg, Australia, Hong Kong and Singapore. SS&C also services mutual fund structures in many other fund domiciles.

Global Investor and Distribution Solutions (GIDS) is the business unit offering this role. GIDS uses digital services to deliver global omni-channel investor servicing, including a contact centre.

The Product & Innovation team within SS&C Global Investor & Distribution Services, create, develop, enhance and maintain digital products & services that support our global clients. The role of the Digital Delivery Manager is accountable for both the delivery of digital products to new and existing clients and the delivery of digital product enhancements that improve product functionality and service to the benefit of all clients (current and prospective).

Melbourne, Australia

As a Digital Delivery Manager, you will help build and drive a cross-functional team including product owners, business analysts, developers, and QA, using best practice methodologies, to deliver to agreed timelines, budget, quality expectations, objectives, business case and quality gate measures!

You will also manage and own the client and key stakeholder relationships, produce timely and accurate reporting (updates, RAID logs, budgetary controls, resource requirements etc) and ensure compliance with internal frameworks and governance.

 Product Delivery

  • Own the delivery of the digital products to all required clients and align (where required) the implementations to the existing frameworks.
  • Create repeatable processes to improve subsequent product rollout. 
  • Ensure the delivery framework optimally supports a continual delivery mythology.

Initiation

  • Identify, confirm, and engage with all stakeholders (internal, external and 3rd party) - to ratify scope and objectives.
  • Establish governance structures and confirm roles and responsibilities.
  • Confirm objectives, benefits, business cases, products, and strategic themes - agree on critical success factors.
  • Identify relevant scrum teams and ensure sprint delivery/outputs align.
  • Confirm testing strategy and agree on criteria for production acceptance.
  • Identify dependencies and align plans.
  • Identify actions, risks, assumptions, issues, and dependencies.
  • Review the Lessons Learnt log (from previous projects) for any relevant items to incorporate into planning.

Monitoring and Communication

  • Prepare and execute stakeholder communication plans.
  • Maintain regular, relevant, timely and accurate communications with stakeholders across all locations and time zones.        
  • Provide reporting to various stakeholder audiences, setting and managing expectations at all stages.
  • Chair and document meetings, initiate and facilitate discussions including management of issues, and getting collective agreement on next steps.
  • Ensure quality gate requirements are met at relevant stages during the project lifecycle.
  • Document and track issues through to resolution, prioritising and escalating as appropriate.

Team Management

  • Maintain a culture of collaboration across all team members and wider stakeholders (and their teams) – provide regular, relevant updates and communication.
  • Manage, support & motivate the delivery team – maintain a deliverable focus.
  • Ensure benefits and strategic relevance are fully understood.

Facilitation

  • Manage and monitor RAID.
  • Manage changes to plans, assess the impact on the business case and escalate as appropriate.
  • Identify and resolve potential resource conflicts, and escalate as necessary.
  • Prepare and run Steering Committees where required.

Project Diligence

  • Maintain governance: follow best practice project methodology and use approved document templates.
  • Keep all documents up to date, accurate, formatted, in the correct folder structure, version controlled, and ready for audit inspections.
  • Complete a Closure Report within the Service Level Agreement (SLA) timeframe.
  • Ensure compliance with Information Security, data protection requirements etc.

Continuous Improvement

  • Support the adoption of Agile within the team and how Project Management will integrate with the implementation.
  • Highlight key issues experienced and capture approaches/actions taken to resolve   - feed into lessons learnt for the benefit of future projects (and capture relevant information from other project team members).
  • Highlight process improvements implemented during the project and communicate to the Line Manager to consider the application in future projects/other activities.
  • Complete Post-Implementation Review (PIR) as appropriate to identify positive outcomes and areas for improvement in future implementations.

Project Budgetary Control

  • Maintain control of budget expenditure across all areas and activities
  • Provide budgetary reporting by updating project spreadsheets.
  • Undertake financial monitoring throughout the project lifecycle.
  • Provide detailed explanations for any deviation from the budget, according to agreed contingency criteria, ensuring early escalation if required.

Your Experience

  • Proven project delivery over a minimum of 5 years, working in Wealth Management/Transfer agency/Investments related.
  • Ability to drive change and effectively manage projects and stakeholders.
  • Client-focused – inspires collaboration with others.
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills; must be articulate and persuasive.
  • Highly motivated, with strong problem-solving and analytical skills, proactive.
  • A strong understanding of financial control, budget management, and risk and issue management.
  • Knowledge and experience in structured project management methodologies and tools including Atlassian tool set.
  • Ability to work under pressure, always maintaining a calm and assertive manner.
  • High level of interpersonal and teamwork skills with the ability to build and maintain strong relationships with senior managers, managers, and colleagues across the organisation.

Desirables

  • Machine Learning experience
  • Project Management certification, Prince 2 or Agile.
  • Managing and influencing senior stakeholders
  • Able to demonstrate leadership skills to provide direction, support, influence and mentoring of project managers.
  • Previous experience within financial services change environment.
  • Knowledge of Transfer Agency operations.

We encourage applications from people of all backgrounds and particularly welcome applications from under-represented groups, to enable us to bring a diversity of perspectives to our thinking and conversation. It's important to us that we strive to have a workforce that is diverse in the widest sense. Unless explicitly requested or approached by SS&C Technologies, Inc. or any of its affiliated companies, the company will not accept unsolicited resumes from headhunters, recruitment agencies, or fee-based recruitment services.

Background Checks

All offers of employment at SS&C are subject to background verification checks, including a 5-year employment history, proof of eligibility to work in the hiring location, proof of address, credit check and criminal record check (where permitted by local law). The accuracy of all information you submit as part of your application is vital and may be used as part of the background checking process should you be successful.

Unless explicitly requested or approached by SS&C Technologies, Inc. or any of its affiliated companies, the company will not accept unsolicited resumes from headhunters, recruitment agencies, or fee-based recruitment services. SS&C offers excellent benefits including health, dental, 401k plan, tuition and professional development reimbursement plan. SS&C Technologies is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and does not discriminate against any applicant for employment or employee on the basis of race, color, religious creed, gender, age, marital status, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other classification protected by applicable discrimination laws.

description:
Job Expectations

Build your career and Australia’s future.

Not many people can say they are working on building Australia’s future. With us you’ll be doing just that, leaving a legacy for all Australians. Plus, there’s equal employment, great training, and true flexible working arrangements.

A bit about your role

You will play a pivotal role in guiding a team of Portfolio and DSO support analysts. Your primary responsibility will be to manage and coordinate monthly CAPEX cost allocation and forecasting activities and deliverables, providing financial, resource, and commercial data-driven insights to Portfolio Value Streams and Service Teams. This role is crucial in enabling effective decision-making across SEO and its business partners.

You will work closely with the Senior Manager – Commercial and Operations to achieve business value outcomes and foster strong relationships with GMs and senior leaders. Your efforts will support SEO OPEX cost initiatives, ensuring budgetary constraints and target run rates are met.

Key responsibilities include leading a team, managing financial governance and reporting, supporting resource management, and driving continuous improvement and innovation within the team.

A bit about you

You will bring several years of experience in managing metrics & reporting and cost optimisation functions within a large corporation, ideally within Telco industry. Your knowledge PMO and commercial function, as well as, familiarity across IT environment technologies and their support systems, coupled with your experience in engaging with third-party service providers, makes you an asset. You excel in financial budget compliance and program cost allocation and reporting and have a proven track record in customer and stakeholder relationship management.

Your solid customer service skills enable you to exceed service satisfaction standards, and you have a knack for engaging at all business levels, forging strong relationships with key internal and external stakeholders. You possess commercial and financial acumen, with experience in implementing contracts, reviewing invoices, and conducting IT budgeting forecasts. You have successfully led and built teams from the ground up, establishing trusted relationships with key business stakeholders and driving key initiatives to meet business outcomes. Your process-driven mindset and strategic viewpoint are essential for this role.

You are a clear communicator and you deliver messages effectively and manage stakeholders and staff with ease. You are committed to adhering to company policies and procedures, ensuring safety for yourself and others. You lead with authenticity, manage teams and stakeholder communications openly, and possess highly developed interpersonal awareness and leadership skills. You are focused on developing direct reports and others, building a culture of trust, inclusion, and teamwork. Your strong written and verbal communication skills, along with your technical analysis and solution preparation abilities, round out your profile as an ideal candidate for this role.

Life at nbn

To be part of nbn is to be part of something bigger. There’s so much more from here. Our pioneering spirit drives us forward every day. Together, we help lift the digital capability of the nation by building and connecting Australia’s best fibre infrastructure into homes and businesses, plus places and things, everywhere. We’re continuing to create Australia’s network—a network made for more. Not just a way for everyone to do the things they love but transforming the way they do them.

A more inclusive working world

nbn is committed to an inclusive, flexible, and supportive workplace where everyone can feel heard, valued, and respected. We believe diverse perspectives are the key to unlocking greater outcomes and encourage applications from people of all ages, nationalities, abilities, and cultures. We champion equal opportunities for all employees. If you have any special requests or accessibility requirements throughout the recruitment process, please recommend us at the time of application (via recruitment@nbnco.com.au) and we will adjust to meet your needs.

Where to from here?

If you think this role might be for you, we want to hear from you. Please apply by following the links and sending in your resume only. We do not require a cover letter or any selection criteria to be addressed.

Please note that this role is Permanent Opportunity and applications for this role will close at midnight on 20th October.

To be eligible for this role, you must have full working rights in Australia.

Worker Type
Permanent Time Type

Full time

description:
Position: Senior DataOps Engineer

Location: Melbourne, Sydney or Brisbane

Job Type: 12 months Fixed Term Contract, likely to extend or convert to permanent

 

About the role

We are seeking an experienced Senior DataOps Engineer for our client in the SaaS industry . As a Senior Engineer, you will be pivotal in the following:

  • Provide and maintain critical data infrastructure for large data pipelines and applications.
  • Develop and implement data pipelines using DevOps practices, ensuring automated testing for both code and data.
  • Design data security frameworks and support the creation of implementation strategies.
  • Lead automation efforts, building and maintaining CI/CD pipelines for data products and applications.
  • Collaborate effectively with other members of the Data team.

 

A Bit About You

We are looking for an individual who ideally possesses the following qualifications and experiences:

  • Proficient in CI/CD tools such as Teamcity, GitHub Actions, Jenkins, Harness, and CircleCI.
  • Experienced in infrastructure-as-code tools like Terraform and CloudFormation.
  • Expertise in containerisation with Docker and Kubernetes, alongside solid understanding of DevOps practices.
  • Advanced knowledge of SQL, Snowflake, dbt, Python, and AWS, including Serverless technologies (Lambda, SQS, SNS, S3, Glue).
  • Skilled in technical documentation with clear and effective oral and written communication.
  • Experienced with orchestration tools such as Apache Airflow and Prefect.
  • Proficient in cloud infrastructure deployment and maintenance

If you are an experienced DataOps Engineer looking to learn more about this opportunity, click ‘Apply’ today and we'll be happy to reach out and discuss further.

description:
Company Description

At Shift, we’re business specialists dedicated to helping Australian SMEs take control of their cashflow, streamline trade terms and choose the right financial products.  

We believe Australian businesses are the driving force behind our economy and are core to our communities. That’s why our business expertise, focus on relationships, and market-leading technology is at the core of everything we do.  

Our unique approach to product innovation combined with our collaborative culture means you can build your career in a supportive environment. You’ll be joining a diverse team of over 250 people who are always looking to deliver better outcomes for Australian businesses. 

Job Description

We are seeking a highly skilled QA Automation Lead to join our team in Sydney. In this role, you will be responsible for performing the testing of Finance products which involves Test Planning, Execution, Automation, Regression and Production verification to ensure all the business product’s quality requirements are met. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to identify and prioritise the requirements of the products, and you will lead the quality driven testing across the business.

What you’ll do: 

  • Enable the team to ensure delivery of high quality products through contribution to the development and implementation of a comprehensive quality strategy for the platform and services the team is responsible for.
  • Provide guidance and mentorship across the team on matters related to testing practice and approach
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and prioritise test requirements, and to ensure that all features and changes are thoroughly tested and meet quality standards
  • Create and maintain test plans, test cases, test scenarios, and test scripts to ensure the platform and services are thoroughly tested and meet the expectations of our users and the business
  • Design, development, implementation and maintenance of a test automation suite integrated with the team’s CI/CD pipeline for the purpose of supporting a continuous quality approach
  • Identify, triage, manage and track defects, working with Stakeholders, Product Managers, Developers and Software Engineers to ensure they are resolved effectively
  • Participate in the planning, guidance and execution of user acceptance testing and other testing activities
  • Remain up-to-date with industry best practice and trends in QA and testing, leading the testing activities and continuous improvements in process within the team

Qualifications

What you’ll bring: 

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related field
  • 10+ years of experience in Software Testing and Quality Assurance (Software Engineering experience will also be considered)
  • Strong understanding of, and 2+ years experience with automated testing tools, frameworks and processes (e.g. Cypress, Selenium, TestRail, etc)
  • Experience with programming and scripting languages (e.g. JavaScript, C# or Java)
  • Strong understanding of software delivery lifecycle, testing methodologies and tools with experience working in an agile organisation as part of a scrum team
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams
  • Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to troubleshoot and debug complex issues Experience coaching and mentoring teams in the area of testing and quality practice
  • Experience working with a fintech or with financial software development and knowledge of Australian regulatory requirements relevant to the fintech industry is a plus

Additional Information

Key benefits: 

  • Collaborative teams – a flat structure means everyone can learn from colleagues and senior leaders around the business.  
  • Be involved – come together with all of your colleagues every 100 days to share the product and technology roadmap and business strategy.  
  • Flexible working environment – we’re headquartered in North Sydney with state-based workplaces and offer a flexible work policy.  
  • Family support – industry leading 26 weeks paid parental leave.  
  • Varied workspaces – our office enables areas for collaboration, brainstorming and socialising as well as focus zones. 
  • Range of benefits – supporting your physical, psychological and financial wellbeing.

description:
CRM Officer – 12-month contract, full time, based Melbourne

Healthscope is seeking an experienced and motivated CRM Officer to support our growth agenda through expert management of our Customer Relationship Management (CRM) system - Salesforce. This role is pivotal in implementing and maintaining streamlined processes to ensure optimal use of Salesforce across the organisation.

You will facilitate comprehensive education and training in Salesforce, generate market insights and trends through automated data and reporting, and provide essential technical support in collaboration with our IT team.

As the CRM Officer, your responsibilities will include:

·       Salesforce administration and maintenance

·       Process implementation and optimisation

·       Education and training

·       Reporting and analytics

·       User support, issue resolution and continuous process improvement

Essential Criteria:

  • Salesforce Administration: 2-4 years of hands-on experience as a Salesforce administrator or in a similar role, with a strong track record of managing and optimising CRM environments
  • Data Management: Experience with data management practices, including data imports, exports, deduplication and data integrity
  • User Support and Training: Demonstrated experience in providing user support and training, with the ability to communicate technical information to non-technical users effectively
  • Process Improvement: Proven experience in developing and implementing process improvements, workflows, and automation within Salesforce.
  • Reporting and Analytics: Experience in creating and maintaining reports and dashboards to provide actionable insights to stakeholders
  • System Integration: Familiarity with integrating Salesforce with other systems and applications, using tools such as APIs, middleware, or third-party connectors
  • Project Management: Basic project management skills, including the ability to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously.

Would you like to know more?

For a confidential discussion, please contact State Business Development Manager NSW/ACT, Nicola Pellegrini via

Why Healthscope?

We care about your career at Healthscope.

Healthscope is Australia's only national private hospital operation and healthcare provider with a network of 39 hospitals that service every state and territory. People are at the heart of our organisation. We employ over 19,000 people and work with almost as many accredited medical practitioners nationwide. Our people are known for achieving exceptional clinical outcomes, transparent public reporting and positive patient feedback that is industry leading.

No matter the role, every day our people make a difference to the lives of our patients, their families and carers, and we consider it a privilege to be part of their journey.

As part of the OneHealthscope Community of Care, you’ll be supported by committed leaders and work with strong, innovative teams who always strive to deliver exceptional care and positive experiences. We encourage the pursuit of continuous professional development, specialisation and education, and support our people to achieve their goals.

Applications close: 8th November 2024
To Apply: Please click on the 'Apply' button to be taken to our online application form. For any questions, please reach out to 

More Information: Our commitment to quality and safety for our patients, staff and visitors is our highest priority. Applicants will be required to consent to a current National Police check, WWCC (where applicable) and Evidence of right to work in Australia prior to appointment. Staff in patient contact roles will be required to provide proof of immunity to specified infectious diseases as a Category A Healthcare worker.

  • Temporary, Full-Time up to 12 months
  • Parramatta


About us

The NSW Police Force (NSWPF) is one of the largest police forces in the western world, with more than 20,000 employees, including more than 4,000 administrative employees who support the sworn officers that provide a range of law and order services 24 hours a day, seven days a week to the socially, geographically and culturally diverse community of NSW.

About the role

We have an opportunity for a Technical Support Officer to be part of our Microsoft Infrastructure Platform, Technology & Communication Services Command. The Technical Support Officer provides broad-ranging support to users, undertake hardware engineering and software configuration activities, troubleshoots and resolves issues across NSWPF ICT environment.

For more information on this role (e.g. essential requirements, key accountabilities and capabilities required for the role), click here (add link to RD) to view the role description.

What we can offer you

At NSWPF our people have access to a range of benefits that help balance life at work and at home. Some of the benefits available when you join the NSWPF include:

  • competitive salary;
  • flexible work options
  • annual leave loading;
  • corporate wellbeing programs including seminars and the Fitness Passport;
  • free annual influenza vaccination;
  • salary packaging options via superannuation contributions or a novated vehicle lease;
  • convenient location for public transport and to shops etc;
  • in-house gym facilities. 

How to Apply

Applications can only be submitted electronically via the I Work for NSW website.

To be considered for this role, attach a cover letter (2 pages maximum) and an up-to-date resume that clearly details your skills & experience as relevant to this role.

Please do not attach copies of qualifications, certificates or documentation (other than what has been requested) - you can bring these if called for interview.

Please address each of the following Target Questions (300 word limit per question) in the text boxes provided in the online application or attach as a separate document.

Target Question 1:

You will be working and supporting end users with many technologies such as Microsoft 365, Configuration Manager, Exchange online, Teams. Can you describe a situation where you successfully managed a modern workplace environment?. Please include details on how you handled various aspects such as user support, system updates, security, and compliance. What strategies did you implement to ensure smooth operations.

Target Question 2:

  • an Australian Citizen;
  • a permanent resident of Australia; or
  • a New Zealand citizen.

Prior to commencement, the successful candidate will be required to undergo a rigorous National Police (criminal history) Check and obtain and maintain a Security Clearance as determined by the NSW Police Force.

Our commitment to Diversity:

The NSW Police Force is a proud employer of a diverse range of people. Differences are embraced, contributions are valued, and everyone has a sense of connection and belonging.

If you identify as Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander and would like assistance with your application, please contact the NSWPF Aboriginal Employment & Engagement team at PCC-AEET@police.nsw.gov.au.

description:
Are you passionate about IT technology solutions and skilled in the IT Support, Cyber Security and Advanced Business networks? Are you looking for an exciting opportunity to join a dynamic team and drive business growth in the IT industry? Look no further! We are seeking a talented and motivated IT Support Technician to join our team in Mildura.

Company Overview:  

Technado’s vision is to empower businesses through IT technology solutions. Bring world class cyber security and data protection too small to medium businesses. Keep ourselves accountable and continuously elevate our service to the next level.  

Technado is an IT MSP Company, and our purpose is to improve our customers businesses through technology by making IT easy and not adding unnecessary complexity, providing them with old school face to face service that is often lacking today. Our focus is on building strong, long-lasting relationships with our customers by understanding their needs, delivering personalized IT recommendations, and having them see our staff as part of their team. Ultimately, we work and live together in the same communities, we must act like it.  

Position Overview: 

The IT technician will install and maintain computer systems, networks and servers aiming for the highest functionality. The IT technician will also ensure efficient use of applications and equipment. The goal is to build and maintain updated and efficient servers, computer systems and networks.  To roll out Cyber Security best practises and Cloud Solutions to clients. 

Objectives of this role 

Support requests: Maintaining IT systems so employees can work effectively and efficiently.  Provide computer and technical support to employees and clients. 

Technical specialist: Provide IT recommendations for clients and businesses. 

Network Admin: Run site maintenance tasks and proactive maintenance for clients and businesses. 

Project work: Design, setup and install new computer systems, cloud services, servers and network equipment. 

Protect Clients: implement and improve cyber security practices at various levels. 

Responsibilities of this role 

Cloud system Planning, designing, developing, configuring and commissioning networks and cloud systems. Mostly Microsoft 365 products. 

Monitoring the overall performance of systems to assess the need for updates, upgrades, enhancements, preventive maintenance and new systems.  

Recommending options for upgrading and improving the performance of networks and systems. 

Manage domains, DNS and customer email setup. 

Providing troubleshooting and service support in diagnosing, resolving and correcting problems. 

Developing and documenting strategies, policies and procedures relating to the use of IT technologies and services.  Determining software and hardware requirements to provide solutions to problems. 

Assessing the performance of IT technologies and services, identifying limitations and inefficiencies, and recommending and implementing solutions. 

Providing troubleshooting and service support in diagnosing, resolving and correcting problems associated with the use of IT technologies and service. 

Ensuring efficient use of applications and equipment. 

Repairing and replacing peripheral equipment such as computers, printers and routers. 

Providing information relating to cyber security and services that need added technical knowledge. 

Assisting with proposals when expert technical knowledge is required. 

 

Competitive base salary. 

Ongoing training and professional development opportunities.  

Opportunity for career growth and advancement within a rapidly expanding organization.  

Dynamic and collaborative work environment with a supportive team. 

If you are a motivated and results-oriented individual with a passion for technology and cyber security, we want to hear from you! Join our team and help drive success together in the exciting world of IT Managed Services.  

How to Apply:  

To apply for this position, please submit your resume and a cover letter outlining your relevant experience and why you believe you would be a great fit for this role. We look forward to reviewing your application and discussing the opportunity further with qualified candidates.  

   

Technado

description:
Hall & Prior Health & Aged Care Group is a family-owned aged care provider operating 36 residential aged care homes, with in-home and community care programs in WA and NSW. We believe that our commitment to providing high quality care can make a real difference to the lives of our consumers and their families.

We are seeking a skilled HR System Administrator to join our ICT team on a full-time basis, based out of our Freshfields facility in Carlisle.

About the role

Reporting to Senior Manager – ICT Applications, you will be responsible for ensuring our HR Information System is secure, efficient, and aligned with our organisation’s goals, optimising the day-to-day workflows of our HR and Payroll team. This role will also assist with any technical queries relating to our HRIS, as well as providing guidance and support for any optimisations and enhancements within the system.

What you’ll need to succeed?

To be successful in the role, you’ll need to possess the following:

  • Experience in managing changes to HRIS processes or systems, including user acceptance testing and feedback collection
  • Familiarity with HR processes such as recruitment, onboarding, performance management, and employee relations
  • Previous experience in training staff on HRIS functionalities and providing ongoing technical support
  • SQL database management, analysis and reporting
  • Experience providing technical support to HR staff and end-users, addressing system-related issues and inquiries
  • National Police Clearance (obtained in last six months)
  • Evidence of 2024 Influenza vaccination (or be willing to obtain)
  • Full working rights in Australia

What we have to offer

Our people are integral to achieving our vision of being a leading aged care provider in Australia. As well as being part of an inspiring and rewarding working environment, the benefits of working for Hall & Prior include a competitive remuneration package, flexible work arrangements, access to retail discounts via flareHR app, ongoing training and development opportunities and commitment to employee wellness.

What to do now

If this sounds like the role for you, apply now!

To view our suite of homes across WA and NSW, click here

As an equal opportunity employer, we encourage people from diverse backgrounds to apply.

Compassionate people, dedicated to care.

description:
About Accenture 

Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries, we offer Strategy and Consulting, Technology and Operations services and Accenture Song — all powered by the world’s largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers. Our 750,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success for our clients, people, shareholders, partners and communities. Visit us at www.accenture.com.

Join Accenture and help transform leading organisations and communities around the world.  The sheer scale of our capabilities and client engagements and the way we collaborate, operate and deliver value provides an unparalleled opportunity to grow and advance.  Choose Accenture and make delivering innovative work part of your extraordinary career. 

Required Skills

  • 3+ years of experience in Design and Implementation using skills in routing, switching, wireless technologies

  • 2+ years’ experience in design and implementation of SD-LAN and SD-WAN solution ( Juniper SD-LAN experience is desirable)

  • Design and implementation of Cloud networking solution for Google, Azure and AWS Cloud Platform (Minimum one Cloud platform experience is preferred )

  • Design and implementation of NexGen firewalls from leading vendors such as Cisco, Juniper, Palo Alto.

  • Experience in developing technical design documentation such as high-level design, low-level design, bill of material (BoM), configuration templates.

  • Develop network testing strategy, Test plans and testing execution.

  • Build cut-over/implementation plan in compliance with client's change management process. 

  • Support troubleshooting efforts during implementation and post go-live support.

  • Strong documentation and presentation skills with a focus on quality.

Due to the secure nature of the role, Australian citizens with a federal government security clearance will be preferred.

Benefits of working at Accenture:

  • 18 weeks paid parental leave

  • Long & short-term career break opportunities

  • Structured career development program

  • Local and international career opportunities.

  • Certified as a Family Inclusive Workplace™

  • Flexible Work Arrangements - centered around Accenture’s Truly Human ethos and our commitment to supporting the health and wellbeing of our people.

  • We are proud to be in the top 3 of last year’s Diversity & Inclusion Index!

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement for Australia:

At Accenture, we recognise that our people are multi-dimensional, and we create a work environment where all people feel like they can bring their authentic selves to work, every day.

Our unwavering commitment to inclusion and diversity unleashes innovation and creates a culture where everyone feels they have equal opportunity. Our range of progressive policies support flexibility in ‘where’, ‘when’ and ‘how’ our people work to ensure that Accenture is an organisation where you can strive for more, achieve great things and maintain the balance and wellbeing you need.

We encourage applications from all people, and we are committed to removing barriers to the recruitment process and employee lifecycle. All employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, disability status, ethnicity, gender, gender identity or expression, religion or sexual orientation and we do not tolerate discrimination. If you require adjustments to the recruitment process or have a preferred communication method, please email exectalent@accenture.com and cite the relevant Job Number, or contact us on +61 2 9005 5000.

To ensure our workplace is inclusive and diverse we are setting bold goals and taking comprehensive action. To achieve these goals, we collect information that allows us to track the effectiveness of our Inclusion and Diversity programs. Learn how Accenture protects your personal data and know your rights in relation to your personal data. Read more about our Privacy Statement.

description:
Tesserent is a full-service cybersecurity solutions provider. We partner with clients across Australia and New Zealand in the protection of their digital assets. With offices across Australia and New Zealand, we partner with clients to provide a full suite of cybersecurity services. Our mission is to be the sovereign cybersecurity provider of choice for the protection of Australia and New Zealand’s digital assets.

Tesserent are looking for a skilled and motivated security consultant to join our team of Canberra-based offensive security specialists. In this role you will work closely with clients to deliver Penetration Testing and Assurance works to cover a range of systems. This role is for an experienced individual who can provide cybersecurity advice to customers; and work collaboratively in team of Penetration Testers.

The successful application will have a demonstrable knowledge of offensive security tooling, and ability to articulate impact from identified vulnerabilities. A strong knowledge of coding and programming skills will be highly regarded. Good communication and inter-personal skills and a willingness to participate in team activities.

This role is based in Canberra and requires the successful applicant to hold a current NV1 security clearance.

Role Responsibilities:

  • Ability to understand and articulate technical information around security practices, standards and cybersecurity, identifying risks and suggested improvements to support business operations,
  • Strong knowledge and experience with ISM essential eight and hardening guidelines.
  • Comfortable using Linux operating systems and offensive security tooling.
  • Deep understanding of computer systems, computer networking, and IT infrastructure.
  • Strong understanding of both front and backend web technologies and communication protocols.

Role Requirements: 

  • Review system documentation and source code to assess security posture of a target platform.
  • Perform penetration testing on web applications, mobile applications, networks, and systems.
  • Utilise a range of offensive security tooling and techniques to identify vulnerabilities.
  • Document and demonstrate exploit chains and attack vectors
  • Engage with clients to understand their security needs and requirements.
  • Plan and manage penetration testing engagements, ensuring they are delivered on time and within scope.
  • Communicate clearly and effectively with clients throughout the engagement, from initial consultation to final debrief.
  • Work with client's development and operations teams to advise on security best practices.
  • Assist in the development and implementation of security policies and procedures.

Knowledge, Skills & Experience:

  • Any relevant education or industry experience will be considered.
  • Candidates holding one of the following certificates will be highly regarded: GPEN, GWAPT, GMOB, GXPN, GCPN, OSCP, OSWE, OSEP, OSEE, CREST, CISSP
  • Demonstrated technical penetration testing experience and knowledge of security fundamentals.
  • Experience working with Federal Government clients.
  • Knowledge of security practices in large organisations.
  • Knowledge of Federal Government IT Security standards.
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

Benefits:

  • Opportunities to undertake technical training and secure industry recognised certifications.
  • Flexible working arrangement with a healthy mix of remote and in-person work.
  • Opportunities to work with some of the best cybersecurity professionals in the region, and to grow and develop your career.
  • Extra leave day per year for your birthday.

description:
Business Intelligence Analyst 

The Client:
A Non-for-Profit organisation looking for a BI Analyst will provide BI and data analytics expertise to teams, programs, and projects across the organisation. They will connect and combine data sources, develop models, and design dashboards and reports to meet the business's needs, extending employees’ ability to make data-driven decisions and provide accurate and compelling ways for other stakeholders to do the same. 

Essential skills Required:
  • Expert skills in Power BI and DAX are essential
  • Skills in data extraction languages and processes, ideally Power Query and M language, SQL/SSRS
  • Skills in business intelligence and data visualisation
  • Skills in data analysis and interpretation
  • Strong interpersonal skills: a clear communicator, able to identify and clarify business needs, discuss potential solutions, and collaborate to get things done
  • Attention to detail to help ensure data integrity and accuracy
Key Requirements:
  • Create, maintain, and enhance over time reports, dashboards and other data visualisations in Power BI and other tools as appropriate to meet business needs.
  • Work closely with various departments to gather data, discuss business processes and understand key metrics to inform development work and troubleshoot any issues.
  • Identify opportunities for enhancing data- and BI-related processes and implementing best-fit practices.
  • Analyse complex data sets to identify trends and patterns, where relevant and appropriate
  • Interpret data and analyse results, e.g., using statistical techniques, where relevant and appropriate

Benefits: 
Work in a True hybrid & flexible working environment in the CBD, 3 days a week in the office. 

If you are interested in this role, please click ‘APPLY’ or alternatively reach out to Jack by emailing jack@emanatetechnology.com.au

description:
About LEAP Dev
LEAP Dev is the “Software House” powering LEAP Legal Software, the leading provider of Legal Practice Productivity Solutions in the world. We’re part of ATI Global – one of the largest international LegalTech companies. For more than 30 years, our curiosity and commitment to continual improvement has kept us reimagining productivity tools for lawyers and their staff to support our guiding purpose, to ‘Help lawyers who help people’. The market leading software we develop and support is used by more than 100,000 lawyers and their staff in small and medium sized law firms.

Working alongside our team of passionate high achievers, you’ll join a fast-growing technology business where things seldom stay the same for long. With more than 1000 smart, caring and ambitious ‘LEAPsters’ working together across Australia, Canada, the United States, the United Kingdom, the Republic of Ireland, Poland and New Zealand, you’ll find yourself in good company here.

What you'll do
As the newest Mid Level .NET Developer you'll join our content team which maintains and develops our content development and distribution system. This is a 100% backend development role which will see your time split between fixes, improvements and feature development. You'll work closely with the Frontend team and Team Manager on deciding what features to build, break down and build features with the team, review code, complete unit tests, ensure operational excellence, and share knowledge broadly across the engineering organisation. Your day-to-day might include:
  • Designing, coding and testing software components
  • Utilising Amazon Web Services to build secure, scalable and highly available solutions
  • Unit testing
  • Working with users and other stakeholders to define and clarify requirements
What you'll bring
You are a focused motivated and hard-working developer who wants to join a fantastic growing team at a critical time and learn on the job to expand your skills. In addition to that you will bring:
  • 4+ years commercial C# development experience including recent versions of ASP.NET Web API
  • Strong knowledge of SOLID principles
  • Experience with AWS Services (S3, Lambdas, Dynamo, Athena etc.)
  • Experience with MS SQL, understanding relational DB design, ability to write complex SQL queries.
  • You are not allergic to web front-end development!
  • A positive attitude – things might not always go as expected but we maintain optimism and win, nonetheless
  • The ability to think out of the box – not all our tasks are standard so neither are the solutions
  • You are a team player – we reach our goals together and help each other to succeed
LEAP is an inclusive, people-first company committed to breaking down institutional barriers that keep people from reaching their potential. If you meet some, but not all of the requirements above, we encourage you to still submit your application.

Why join LEAP Dev?
  • We build and develop a market leading, “Legal Tech” product, with offices in Australia, New Zealand, United States, Canada, United Kingdom and the Republic of Ireland.
  • We are committed to innovation and global expansion of our products and are constantly utilising new technologies to better our client experience.
  • Our hybrid work environment offers the best of both worlds, whether you prefer to be in the office or work from home you have the flexibility to work however suits you and your team.
  • We encourage our employees to have a voice and to collaborate with each other to work on technical solutions, of course we have company visions and goals, but we want you to help us achieve these!
  • We will invest our time and money in you to help develop your career. Open discussions and reviews will help us understand your career aspirations, maybe it’s a new AWS certification you are after or an internal move to a new area, we will support you and your goals
  • As a LEAP Dev employee, you will receive a competitive salary, paid learning and development opportunities, free platinum gym membership, generous parental leave benefits, an additional paid wellbeing day, social events and MUCH MORE!

description:
• Employment Type: full time continuing role as a Cyber Security Controls Assurance Manager
  • Excellent salary package including superannuation
  • Location: UNSW Kensington Campus (Hybrid Working Opportunities)

About UNSW:
UNSW isn’t like other places you’ve worked. Yes, we’re a large organisation with a diverse and talented community, a community doing extraordinary things. Together, we are driven to be thoughtful, practical, and purposeful in all we do. Taking this combined approach is what makes our work matter. If you want a career where you can thrive, be challenged and do meaningful work, you’re in the right place.

The Cyber Security Controls Assurance Manager is responsible for overseeing and advancing the University’s cyber security controls assurance practices, ensuring that cyber security controls are effective, regularly tested, and continuously improved. Key responsibilities include developing and executing strategies for cyber security controls testing, facilitating the remediation of identified gaps, and delivery of cyber security metrics and reporting to support senior management decision-making The Cyber Security Controls Assurance Manager reports to the Head of Cyber Security Governance & Assurance and has direct reports.

Accountabilities:

  • Lead the strategic planning, execution, and continuous improvement of cyber security controls assurance testing, including regular controls effectiveness testing and gap assessments.
  • Develop and implement a continuous controls assurance testing strategy, with a focus on control monitoring, automation, uplift, and rationalisation.
  • Oversee and deliver annual controls assurance testing activities, including penetration testing, application security assessments, and red teaming exercises.
  • Facilitate post-testing assurance by reviewing findings, advising stakeholders, prioritising remediation efforts, and managing closure of actions.
  • Monitor, track, and ensure timely closure of findings, risks, and associated actions resulting from controls assurance activities, ensuring alignment with the University’s risk appetite.
  • Develop, collect, and continuously improve cyber security metrics and Key Risk Indicators (KRIs)/Key Control Indicators (KCIs) to measure performance and risk exposure.
  • Lead the delivery and management of periodic cyber security metrics reporting.
  • Present insights, information, and recommendations to leadership and stakeholders to inform decision-making and support organizational objectives, and present at quarterly GRC Community of Practice (CoP) and Developer Security CoP meetings to foster collaboration and knowledge sharing across faculties and divisions.
  • Update and maintain the cyber security risk register with findings from testing, assessments, and performance metrics, ensuring that risks are tracked and mitigated.
  • Manage audit assurance activities by providing leadership in facilitating the remediation of audit findings, ensuring that identified risks are mitigated in accordance with agreed timelines and corrective actions are successfully implemented.
  • Lead the maturity and management of Cloud Security Posture Management (CSPM) tools, including tuning, ongoing monitoring, and remediation activities.
  • Manage the delivery of expert-level source code reviews, including the integration of applications and repositories with security scanning tools like CXOne.
  • Oversee the management of Checkmarx, ensuring the platform is effectively utilised for source code security scanning and application security assurance.
  • Oversee crowdsourced security testing / bug bounty programs, ensuring these programs are aligned with security objectives and contribute to continuous improvement in security posture.
  • Provide strategic cyber security consulting and advisory services to the Cyber Security Enablement Program and other key initiatives across the University, ensuring alignment with governance and compliance standards.
  • Manage and mentor a team, providing guidance, support, and professional development opportunities to ensure high performance and continuous growth.
  • Align with and actively demonstrate the Code of Conduct and Values
  • Cooperate with all health and safety policies and procedures of the university and take all reasonable care to ensure that your actions or omissions do not impact on the psychosocial or physical health and safety of yourself or others.
  • Ensure hazards and risks psychosocial and physical are identified and controlled for tasks, projects, and activities that pose a health and safety risk within your area of responsibility.

Skills and Experience:

  • Extensive management expertise and supporting experience (7+ years) in cyber security controls assurance, with a proven track record in controls assurance testing, metrics reporting, and audit management.
  • Strong experience with cyber security assurance tools such as Checkmarx, Lacework, BugCrowd, and similar platforms.
  • Certifications such as CISSP, CISM, CRISC, CEH, or relevant certifications in security assurance and controls testing are highly desirable.
  • Demonstrated experience in leading penetration testing, red teaming, application security assessments, and cloud security posture management.
  • Strong understanding of cyber security metrics, KRIs/KCIs, and their role in managing and communicating risk.
  • Experience in working with risk registers and driving the remediation of risks and audit findings.
  • Excellent communication, interpersonal, and leadership skills, with a proven ability to influence and engage stakeholders across all levels.
  • Strong project management skills, with the ability to manage multiple initiatives simultaneously while maintaining a focus on quality and timelines.
  • High level of motivation, resilience, and the ability to work both independently and as part of a collaborative team.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to present complex information clearly and concisely to diverse audiences.
  • An understanding of and commitment to UNSW’s aims, objectives and values in action, together with relevant policies and guidelines.
  • Knowledge of health & safety (psychosocial and physical) responsibilities and commitment to attending relevant health and safety training.

To Apply: If this is of interest to you, please submit your CV, Cover Letter and responses to the Skills and Experience outlined above and in the position description.

More Information: visit https://www.jobs.unsw.edu.au/

Contact

Jen MacLachlan, email: j.maclachlan@unsw.edu.au

Applications close: Monday 28th of October at 11.30pm

Benefits and Culture

  • Flexible hybrid working
  • Additional 3 days of leave over the Christmas Period
  • Access to lifelong learning and career development
  • Progressive HR practices
  • Discounts and entitlements 

UNSW is committed to equity diversity and inclusion. Applications from women, people of culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds, those living with disabilities, members of the LGBTIQ+ community; and people of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander descent, are encouraged. UNSW provides workplace adjustments for people with disability, and access to flexible work options for eligible staff.

The University reserves the right not to proceed with any appointment.
teaser: Cyber Security Controls Assurance Manager is responsible for overseeing and advancing the University’s cyber security controls assurance practices.
title: Cyber Security Controls Assurance Manager

description:
Gallagher Bassett (GB) is Australia and New Zealand’s premier third party claims administrator. We manage claims on behalf of insurers, brokers, government bodies and self-insured organisations. We are part of the leading global risk management and insurance group Arthur J Gallagher & Co.

 

Life at GB is an adventure - often fast paced, unpredictable, challenging and deeply rewarding. It is social and engaging, with our unique and positive culture underpinned by The Gallagher Way – values lived daily by our people.

 

In addition to flexible working options, we also offer supportive learning and career pathways and provide ongoing access to training and career development. We invest in our people through strong succession planning and have a number of mentoring and training programs available.

There are some great things happening at GB and, we want YOU to be a part of it all!

 

As we expand further in the NSW workers compensation scheme, we are offering a unique opportunity for an experienced candidate to partner with claims teams to undertake quality assurance and promote best practice across the function.

 

Reporting to the Manager, Claims Excellence and Strategy, this role will see you analyse data and provide valuable insights to support strategic decision-making and drive improvements in workers compensation processes. You will work closely with cross-functional teams, including Operations Claims, Operations Technical, Data & Insights, Learning & Capability, Quality Assurance, Customer Experience and Project Manager to gather and interpret data, identify trends and patterns, and develop actionable recommendations for Continuous Improvement projects. The ideal candidate will have a strong analytical mindset, excellent problem-solving skills, and a deep understanding of workers compensation regulations and processes.

 


Responsibilities
  • Work closely with cross-functional teams to understand business objectives and develop service design improvement solutions for the business;
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to define business requirements and ensure data accuracy and integrity;
  • Conduct market research and competitive analysis to identify industry trends and best practices in workers compensation;
  • Provide recommendations based on data analysis to drive improvements in workers compensation processes and outcomes;
  • Support the development and implementation of data-driven strategies and initiatives to reduce costs, meet legislative requirements and improve outcomes;
  • Facilitate harvesting or improvement ideas from within our business ensuring they are captured and prioritised based on potential for performance uplift/benefit. 

Qualifications
  1. Proven experience as a Business Analyst or similar role in the workers compensation field;
  2. Strong analytical skills and the ability to interpret complex data sets related to workers compensation claims;
  3. Proficiency in data analysis tools and software (e.g., Excel, SQL, Tableau, Power BI);
  4. Excellent problem-solving and critical-thinking abilities;
  5. Strong communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively communicate complex information to stakeholders;
  6. Deep understanding of workers compensation regulations, processes, and best practices;
  7. Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders in the workers compensation field;
  8. Attention to detail and the ability to manage multiple projects and priorities.
teaser: Analysing data and provide valuable insights to support strategic decision-making and drive improvements in workers compensation processes!
title: Process Improvement Analyst - Claims Excellence and Strategy

description:
So... How many app developers does it take to turn on a light? At least one more! 

LIFX is looking for a talented Mobile App Engineer to join our Software Engineering Team in Melbourne to help us evolve our mobile apps with some exciting new products, features, and experiences in 2024 and beyond.  

The LIFX mobile apps allow our customers to control and automate their Wi-Fi-enabled lighting, both at home and from around the world. Our products support a rich ecosystem of partner integrations, and the app is central to that experience. 

Working as a part of the LIFX Engineering Team gives you the opportunity to work with consumer Internet of Things (IoT) products. At LIFX, you get the opportunity to get exposure to a broad technical stack, from the firmware on our devices to our cloud infrastructure and public APIs. 

LIFX has just been acquired by a dominant player in the United States lighting and smart home industry, Feit Electric. Together under the LIFX brand, LIFX will deliver Product experiences which are unmatched in the industry. Feit Electric provides us with the stability of a large business, yet we will continue to maintain our start-up-like culture in our Product and Engineering teams. 

LIFX is a small team, mostly based around Australia, with our main office in Richmond, Victoria. We offer flexible working hours and the opportunity to work from home as needed. As a creative business that takes product ideas from design to manufacturing, we place a high value on diversity of opinion and ways of working. Our goal is to make the most innovative products in the market, and we need a dynamic team to achieve that goal. 

 

Skills 

Readiness to learn new technologies, read documentation and deepen your skills 

Comfortability becoming familiar with complex systems and working through nuanced problems 

Experience developing native mobile apps, preferably on Android 

Experience with Kotlin or other Object-Oriented programming languages, such as Swift 

Comfortability working with a Continuous Delivery/Continuous Integration model, using tools such as DevOps Pipelines, GitHub Actions, or BuildKite 

Experience working with UI and UX Designers, utilising collaboration tools such as Figma or Miro 

Experience with Agile development practices such as Scrum or Kanban 

 

Helpful 

Experience with Jetpack Compose or SwiftUI 

Familiarity with networking technologies such as Wi-Fi, Thread, or Bluetooth Low Energy 

Experience with Smart Home platforms e.g., Matter, Amazon Alexa, Google Home, or Apple HomeKit 

Experience with Kotlin Multiplatform 

Experience with automated software testing, such as Unit Testing or Integration Testing 

 

We strongly encourage diverse candidates to apply, including women, Aboriginal people, people from multicultural backgrounds, people with disability, veterans, and people over 45 years old.
teaser: LIFX is looking for a talented Mobile App Engineer
title: Mobile App Engineer

description:
About the business

 

INSTANDA Asia Pacific is an award winning scale-up in the Asia Pacific insurance market challenging the status quo. We have the distribution rights to an exciting software tool which fundamentally changes how companies who sell insurance can design and deliver insurance products to the market. We work directly with Insurers, Underwriting Agencies, and Brokers. Using leading edge technologies, the INSTANDA no-code insurance software is entirely configurable from the ground up. Due to ongoing growth, we are now looking to grow our configuration / business analyst resource.

About the role

This position focuses on the scoping / requirements gathering / solution design and associated configuration aspect for our clients and customers. Working within a small team you will be responsible for customer success by ensuring all aspects of defining the client's requirements (and our associated configuration activities) are completed to the right quality in accordance to the requirements stage plan you'll manage.   

Responsibilities will include:

  • Organising, preparing for and running product discovery sessions with prospective and existing clients
  • Gathering and defining client requirements / business processes and the associated configuration implementation plan
  • Implementing, configuring and supporting the selected INSTANDA solution (we provide training – no coding required)
  • Supporting the UAT process of the INSTANDA configuration and of new functionalities
  • Taking a hands-on approach to trouble shooting
  • Participating in other pre-sales activities such as requests for proposal and / or Discovery and Design sessions 
  • Note: Travel may be required to other capital cities and potentially internationally within Asia Pacific in order to support our clients

Benefits and perks

  • 4 day working week - we value the opportunity to disconnect
  • Salary negotiable with opportunity to share in the growing success of the INSTANDA Asia Pacific business
  • You have the opportunity to be part of a small team using an award winning software platform to make big changes within the Asia Pacific market
  • Flexible working with main office based on the northern Gold Coast (Oxenford) and working from home part of our DNA

Skills and experience

  • A degree in Maths, Business, Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent degree is an asset but not a requirement
  • Experience of SaaS or platform technology solutions will be a distinct advantage
  • Ability to manage competing deadlines in a fast-paced environment, including at least 2 years of direct experience within the Insurance sector
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills with a flair to express technical concepts in an everyday language
  • Note that this role will involve interaction with our global partners so may involve flexible working to reflect different timezones - an ability to self manage time and outputs is key
teaser: Configuration / Business analysts help understand our clients needs and ensure they get the most out of the INSTANDA platform.

description:
Then the Technical Deployment Analyst role with Equinix could be what you have been waiting for!

About the role

The Technical Deployment Analyst (TDA) will be amongst varying and often concurrent projects. Project Management or co-ordination, implementation or even operations experience from a Data Centre or similar environment will be highly regarded.

Delivering expertise with cage design, install and structured cabling for new and existing customer deployments within the data center, TDA’s play a crucial role in the business and work with many key stakeholders - including our onsite Engineering teams, Capacity and Sales Engineers, vendors and above all our valued customers.

Due to the nature of the projects we are looking for someone who will be predominantly based onsite working closely with the Operations teams, vendors and suppliers – so the TDA will be able to run programs well ahead of time and be super organised, ana phenomenal communicator. The role will be based at PE3.

Requirements & Support:

  • Develops professional expertise to support deployment projects by validating customers' order requirements with the customer processing team and other partners.

  • Project manages the technical deployment responsibilities with the data center manager.

  • Develops technical knowledge of the data center and recommends solutions, while in partnership with more senior team members, to address internal issues within a moderate scope.

  • Applies learned techniques to facilitate smooth service delivery and ensure provisioned services meet and exceed customers' expectations.

  • Receives general instructions from expert teams and team members in providing solutions cross-functionally to resolve customers' non-standard order requirements

  • Supports reinstall projects where required

  • Project Planning, Implementation and Delivery

  • Multi-functional, Support & Communications

  • Process Support/Optimization

  • Systems Support, Data Support/Analysis and Vendor support

Benefits of the role:

  • Fast paced position where you will be challenged to succeed in the position!

  • Encouraging management and operations teams to work alongside

  • Joining an established industry leader in a growing market that harness and promotes personal and professional development

  • Annual salary review and bonus, company shares and access to loads of company employee and wellness benefits!

  • Free, onsite parking at all Equinix data centres!

Ideally candidates will come with 2+ years in a similar role (Electrical/Data Centre/Customer Deployment and configuration) or with transferrable skills and experience to develop into the positions quickly. Practical work experience, Bachelor Degree or relevant Trade Certificate (Electrical) is encouraged as will the ability to attain and maintain information quickly.

Equinix is committed to ensuring that our employment process is open to all individuals, including those with a disability. If you are a qualified candidate and need assistance or an accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.

Equinix is an Equal Employment Opportunity and, in the U.S., an Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to unlawful consideration of race, color, religion, creed, national or ethnic origin, ancestry, place of birth, citizenship, sex, pregnancy / childbirth or related medical conditions, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital or domestic partnership status, age, veteran or military status, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, political / organizational affiliation, status as a victim or family member of a victim of crime or abuse, or any other status protected by applicable law.

description:
Are you interested in supporting Atherton State Primary School Leadership, staff and students as a Senior Computer Assistant?

Our school invites suitably qualified applicants to apply for the role of Senior Computer Assistant. Your role is critical in the day-to-day operations of the school in providing troubleshooting, technical advice and support.

This is a part-time position, 0.46FTE or 30 hours per fortnight, for a temporary duration of 12 months unless otherwise determined.

About our School:

Interested in working on the beautiful Atherton Tablelands? Join us at Atherton State Primary School. We have a strong academic, sporting, cultural and technological focus that is underpinned by our school motto - Achievement Through Endeavour.  This is translated into classroom activities where students are encouraged to not necessarily 'be the best' but 'do their best'.  Atherton Primary School is located on the Atherton Tablelands. Tinaroo Dam is about 15minutes drive away. 

About your Role:

  • Undertake preventative maintenance and routine repairs of all computers and associated equipment throughout the school.
  • Install new equipment and software, and provide advice on options for enhancements. (SFIA Level 3 - ITOP) 
  • You will be working across both Apple and Windows platforms. Atherton Primary is transitioning to predominantly using Windows computers. You will play an integral role in the transition.
  • Provide technical advice and support to teaching and office staff, and to students to resolve problems associated with school computer facilities.
  • Provide technical input and assist in decisions regarding network computers and associated equipment, access to software and their full application, inclusion of computer resources in developing learning and individual programs and selection and purchase of appropriate equipment and compatible software.
  • Assist in the development, maintenance and operations of the school's computerised administrative systems and information databases.
  • Provide information and advice on appropriateness of currently available software and on trends and changes in technology applicable to the school's computer facilities.
  • Develop and oversee procedures and guidelines for the correct and safe operation of computing equipment. (SFIA Level 3 - SFEN)
  • Excellent communication skills as well as being able to work independently or as part of a team are essential for this role.
  • Your enthusiasm and dedication are very welcome - tell us about you and what you might bring to the role!

Please refer to the attached role description for any mandatory requirements for this position. 

Interested? To Apply: 

  • Attach a brief resume including contact details for 2 referees (referees should have an understanding of your relevant work history) 
  • Attach a 2-page written statement in response to the attached role description. 

We welcome all applicants to share any support needed to ensure our recruitment process is inclusive. 

Applications remain current for 12 months from the closing date and may be considered for appointment to identical or similar vacancies within the Department. 

Applications from recruitment agencies will not be accepted. 

When working in regulated employment an employee must have a current Working with Children Clearance (blue card) issued by Blue Card Services.

Salary rate shown is reflective of full-time (1.0 FTE). 

The Department of Education is a family inclusive workplace. Click here to find out more about our Inclusion and Diversity strategies. ( https://alt-qed.qed.qld.gov.au/working-with-us/induction/department/human-resources/inclusion-and-diversity#:~:text=Pathways%20to%20Parity,participate%20fully%20in%20our%20workplaces. )

description:
Position: Network Engineers (Defence)
Location: Adelaide, SA
Type: Permanent, Full-Time
Clearance: NV1 or Higher security clearance required

About the Role:
We are seeking multiple Network Engineers (Mid, Senior, Architect levels) to join our client's Defence focused team on a Permanent basis in Adelaide (Northern Suburb). If you are passionate about network design, ICT security and contributing to critical Defence projects, this is your opportunity to make a significant impact.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Design and analyse network architectures to ensure optimal performance, scalability, and efficiency.
  • Review and refine technical documentation, ensuring precision and clarity in all deliverables.
  • Conduct detailed requirements analysis, ensuring project specifications are met and traceability is maintained throughout.
  • Manage and oversee change processes, ensuring seamless transitions and minimal disruption to operational systems.
  • Estimate, plan, and allocate tasks for small teams, ensuring timely delivery of project milestones.
  • Apply your deep understanding of ICT systems, including operating systems, virtualization and hardware infrastructures, to support network solutions.
  • Safeguard network integrity by applying best practices in networking technologies and ICT security principles.

Essential Skills & Experience:

  • Proven experience in network design and architecture analysis for high performing systems.
  • Strong background in technical documentation review and enhancement.
  • Expertise in requirements analysis and verification traceability.
  • Ability to manage change processes and ensure smooth network transitions.
  • Experience in planning and task estimation for team projects.
  • In-depth understanding of ICT systems (operating systems, virtualisation, hardware infrastructures).
  • Proficient in networking technologies and ICT security principles.
  • Hands-on experience with tools such as:
    • Cisco Routing & Switching
    • BGP
    • IPSEC Tunneling
    • Dell, HP, and Juniper switches

Security Requirement:

This role requires NV1 security clearance or higher due to the nature of the projects within the Defence sector. Applicants without this clearance cannot be considered.

ONLY shortlisted applicants will be contacted.

APPLY NOW for my immediate consideration by submitting your CV. Should you have any questions or queries, please contact Daniel Philip on 0434508345 for a confidential discussion.

At Randstad Digital, we are passionate about providing equal employment opportunities and embracing diversity to the benefit of all. We actively encourage applications from any background.
