description:
Job Expectations

Build your career and Australia’s future.

Not many people can say they are working on building Australia’s future. With us you’ll be doing just that, leaving a legacy for all Australians. Plus, there’s equal employment, great training, and true flexible working arrangements.

A bit about your role

You will play a pivotal role in guiding a team of Portfolio and DSO support analysts. Your primary responsibility will be to manage and coordinate monthly CAPEX cost allocation and forecasting activities and deliverables, providing financial, resource, and commercial data-driven insights to Portfolio Value Streams and Service Teams. This role is crucial in enabling effective decision-making across SEO and its business partners.

You will work closely with the Senior Manager – Commercial and Operations to achieve business value outcomes and foster strong relationships with GMs and senior leaders. Your efforts will support SEO OPEX cost initiatives, ensuring budgetary constraints and target run rates are met.

Key responsibilities include leading a team, managing financial governance and reporting, supporting resource management, and driving continuous improvement and innovation within the team.

A bit about you

You will bring several years of experience in managing metrics & reporting and cost optimisation functions within a large corporation, ideally within Telco industry. Your knowledge PMO and commercial function, as well as, familiarity across IT environment technologies and their support systems, coupled with your experience in engaging with third-party service providers, makes you an asset. You excel in financial budget compliance and program cost allocation and reporting and have a proven track record in customer and stakeholder relationship management.

Your solid customer service skills enable you to exceed service satisfaction standards, and you have a knack for engaging at all business levels, forging strong relationships with key internal and external stakeholders. You possess commercial and financial acumen, with experience in implementing contracts, reviewing invoices, and conducting IT budgeting forecasts. You have successfully led and built teams from the ground up, establishing trusted relationships with key business stakeholders and driving key initiatives to meet business outcomes. Your process-driven mindset and strategic viewpoint are essential for this role.

You are a clear communicator and you deliver messages effectively and manage stakeholders and staff with ease. You are committed to adhering to company policies and procedures, ensuring safety for yourself and others. You lead with authenticity, manage teams and stakeholder communications openly, and possess highly developed interpersonal awareness and leadership skills. You are focused on developing direct reports and others, building a culture of trust, inclusion, and teamwork. Your strong written and verbal communication skills, along with your technical analysis and solution preparation abilities, round out your profile as an ideal candidate for this role.

Life at nbn

To be part of nbn is to be part of something bigger. There’s so much more from here. Our pioneering spirit drives us forward every day. Together, we help lift the digital capability of the nation by building and connecting Australia’s best fibre infrastructure into homes and businesses, plus places and things, everywhere. We’re continuing to create Australia’s network—a network made for more. Not just a way for everyone to do the things they love but transforming the way they do them.

A more inclusive working world

nbn is committed to an inclusive, flexible, and supportive workplace where everyone can feel heard, valued, and respected. We believe diverse perspectives are the key to unlocking greater outcomes and encourage applications from people of all ages, nationalities, abilities, and cultures. We champion equal opportunities for all employees. If you have any special requests or accessibility requirements throughout the recruitment process, please recommend us at the time of application (via recruitment@nbnco.com.au) and we will adjust to meet your needs.

Where to from here?

If you think this role might be for you, we want to hear from you. Please apply by following the links and sending in your resume only. We do not require a cover letter or any selection criteria to be addressed.

Please note that this role is Permanent Opportunity and applications for this role will close at midnight on 20th October.

To be eligible for this role, you must have full working rights in Australia.

Worker Type
Permanent Time Type

Full time

description:
Position: Senior DataOps Engineer

Location: Melbourne, Sydney or Brisbane

Job Type: 12 months Fixed Term Contract, likely to extend or convert to permanent

 

About the role

We are seeking an experienced Senior DataOps Engineer for our client in the SaaS industry . As a Senior Engineer, you will be pivotal in the following:

  • Provide and maintain critical data infrastructure for large data pipelines and applications.
  • Develop and implement data pipelines using DevOps practices, ensuring automated testing for both code and data.
  • Design data security frameworks and support the creation of implementation strategies.
  • Lead automation efforts, building and maintaining CI/CD pipelines for data products and applications.
  • Collaborate effectively with other members of the Data team.

 

A Bit About You

We are looking for an individual who ideally possesses the following qualifications and experiences:

  • Proficient in CI/CD tools such as Teamcity, GitHub Actions, Jenkins, Harness, and CircleCI.
  • Experienced in infrastructure-as-code tools like Terraform and CloudFormation.
  • Expertise in containerisation with Docker and Kubernetes, alongside solid understanding of DevOps practices.
  • Advanced knowledge of SQL, Snowflake, dbt, Python, and AWS, including Serverless technologies (Lambda, SQS, SNS, S3, Glue).
  • Skilled in technical documentation with clear and effective oral and written communication.
  • Experienced with orchestration tools such as Apache Airflow and Prefect.
  • Proficient in cloud infrastructure deployment and maintenance

If you are an experienced DataOps Engineer looking to learn more about this opportunity, click ‘Apply’ today and we'll be happy to reach out and discuss further.

description:
Company Description

At Shift, we’re business specialists dedicated to helping Australian SMEs take control of their cashflow, streamline trade terms and choose the right financial products.  

We believe Australian businesses are the driving force behind our economy and are core to our communities. That’s why our business expertise, focus on relationships, and market-leading technology is at the core of everything we do.  

Our unique approach to product innovation combined with our collaborative culture means you can build your career in a supportive environment. You’ll be joining a diverse team of over 250 people who are always looking to deliver better outcomes for Australian businesses. 

Job Description

We are seeking a highly skilled QA Automation Lead to join our team in Sydney. In this role, you will be responsible for performing the testing of Finance products which involves Test Planning, Execution, Automation, Regression and Production verification to ensure all the business product’s quality requirements are met. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to identify and prioritise the requirements of the products, and you will lead the quality driven testing across the business.

What you’ll do: 

  • Enable the team to ensure delivery of high quality products through contribution to the development and implementation of a comprehensive quality strategy for the platform and services the team is responsible for.
  • Provide guidance and mentorship across the team on matters related to testing practice and approach
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and prioritise test requirements, and to ensure that all features and changes are thoroughly tested and meet quality standards
  • Create and maintain test plans, test cases, test scenarios, and test scripts to ensure the platform and services are thoroughly tested and meet the expectations of our users and the business
  • Design, development, implementation and maintenance of a test automation suite integrated with the team’s CI/CD pipeline for the purpose of supporting a continuous quality approach
  • Identify, triage, manage and track defects, working with Stakeholders, Product Managers, Developers and Software Engineers to ensure they are resolved effectively
  • Participate in the planning, guidance and execution of user acceptance testing and other testing activities
  • Remain up-to-date with industry best practice and trends in QA and testing, leading the testing activities and continuous improvements in process within the team

Qualifications

What you’ll bring: 

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related field
  • 10+ years of experience in Software Testing and Quality Assurance (Software Engineering experience will also be considered)
  • Strong understanding of, and 2+ years experience with automated testing tools, frameworks and processes (e.g. Cypress, Selenium, TestRail, etc)
  • Experience with programming and scripting languages (e.g. JavaScript, C# or Java)
  • Strong understanding of software delivery lifecycle, testing methodologies and tools with experience working in an agile organisation as part of a scrum team
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams
  • Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to troubleshoot and debug complex issues Experience coaching and mentoring teams in the area of testing and quality practice
  • Experience working with a fintech or with financial software development and knowledge of Australian regulatory requirements relevant to the fintech industry is a plus

Additional Information

Key benefits: 

  • Collaborative teams – a flat structure means everyone can learn from colleagues and senior leaders around the business.  
  • Be involved – come together with all of your colleagues every 100 days to share the product and technology roadmap and business strategy.  
  • Flexible working environment – we’re headquartered in North Sydney with state-based workplaces and offer a flexible work policy.  
  • Family support – industry leading 26 weeks paid parental leave.  
  • Varied workspaces – our office enables areas for collaboration, brainstorming and socialising as well as focus zones. 
  • Range of benefits – supporting your physical, psychological and financial wellbeing.

description:
CRM Officer – 12-month contract, full time, based Melbourne

Healthscope is seeking an experienced and motivated CRM Officer to support our growth agenda through expert management of our Customer Relationship Management (CRM) system - Salesforce. This role is pivotal in implementing and maintaining streamlined processes to ensure optimal use of Salesforce across the organisation.

You will facilitate comprehensive education and training in Salesforce, generate market insights and trends through automated data and reporting, and provide essential technical support in collaboration with our IT team.

As the CRM Officer, your responsibilities will include:

·       Salesforce administration and maintenance

·       Process implementation and optimisation

·       Education and training

·       Reporting and analytics

·       User support, issue resolution and continuous process improvement

Essential Criteria:

  • Salesforce Administration: 2-4 years of hands-on experience as a Salesforce administrator or in a similar role, with a strong track record of managing and optimising CRM environments
  • Data Management: Experience with data management practices, including data imports, exports, deduplication and data integrity
  • User Support and Training: Demonstrated experience in providing user support and training, with the ability to communicate technical information to non-technical users effectively
  • Process Improvement: Proven experience in developing and implementing process improvements, workflows, and automation within Salesforce.
  • Reporting and Analytics: Experience in creating and maintaining reports and dashboards to provide actionable insights to stakeholders
  • System Integration: Familiarity with integrating Salesforce with other systems and applications, using tools such as APIs, middleware, or third-party connectors
  • Project Management: Basic project management skills, including the ability to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously.

Would you like to know more?

For a confidential discussion, please contact State Business Development Manager NSW/ACT, Nicola Pellegrini via

Why Healthscope?

We care about your career at Healthscope.

Healthscope is Australia's only national private hospital operation and healthcare provider with a network of 39 hospitals that service every state and territory. People are at the heart of our organisation. We employ over 19,000 people and work with almost as many accredited medical practitioners nationwide. Our people are known for achieving exceptional clinical outcomes, transparent public reporting and positive patient feedback that is industry leading.

No matter the role, every day our people make a difference to the lives of our patients, their families and carers, and we consider it a privilege to be part of their journey.

As part of the OneHealthscope Community of Care, you’ll be supported by committed leaders and work with strong, innovative teams who always strive to deliver exceptional care and positive experiences. We encourage the pursuit of continuous professional development, specialisation and education, and support our people to achieve their goals.

Applications close: 8th November 2024
To Apply: Please click on the 'Apply' button to be taken to our online application form. For any questions, please reach out to 

More Information: Our commitment to quality and safety for our patients, staff and visitors is our highest priority. Applicants will be required to consent to a current National Police check, WWCC (where applicable) and Evidence of right to work in Australia prior to appointment. Staff in patient contact roles will be required to provide proof of immunity to specified infectious diseases as a Category A Healthcare worker.

description:
• Computer System Officer Level 3
  • Temporary, Full-Time up to 12 months
  • Parramatta


About us

The NSW Police Force (NSWPF) is one of the largest police forces in the western world, with more than 20,000 employees, including more than 4,000 administrative employees who support the sworn officers that provide a range of law and order services 24 hours a day, seven days a week to the socially, geographically and culturally diverse community of NSW.

About the role

We have an opportunity for a Technical Support Officer to be part of our Microsoft Infrastructure Platform, Technology & Communication Services Command. The Technical Support Officer provides broad-ranging support to users, undertake hardware engineering and software configuration activities, troubleshoots and resolves issues across NSWPF ICT environment.

For more information on this role (e.g. essential requirements, key accountabilities and capabilities required for the role), click here (add link to RD) to view the role description.

What we can offer you

At NSWPF our people have access to a range of benefits that help balance life at work and at home. Some of the benefits available when you join the NSWPF include:

  • competitive salary;
  • flexible work options
  • annual leave loading;
  • corporate wellbeing programs including seminars and the Fitness Passport;
  • free annual influenza vaccination;
  • salary packaging options via superannuation contributions or a novated vehicle lease;
  • convenient location for public transport and to shops etc;
  • in-house gym facilities. 

How to Apply

Applications can only be submitted electronically via the I Work for NSW website.

To be considered for this role, attach a cover letter (2 pages maximum) and an up-to-date resume that clearly details your skills & experience as relevant to this role.

Please do not attach copies of qualifications, certificates or documentation (other than what has been requested) - you can bring these if called for interview.

Please address each of the following Target Questions (300 word limit per question) in the text boxes provided in the online application or attach as a separate document.

Target Question 1:

You will be working and supporting end users with many technologies such as Microsoft 365, Configuration Manager, Exchange online, Teams. Can you describe a situation where you successfully managed a modern workplace environment?. Please include details on how you handled various aspects such as user support, system updates, security, and compliance. What strategies did you implement to ensure smooth operations.

Target Question 2:

Can you describe the toolsets you have utilized to manage a workplace environment, including both technical and service management tools? Please demonstrate your understanding of these tools and how you have effectively used them in your role.

Your application must stand on its own merits, and the completeness and relevance of your application will determine if you proceed through to the selection process.

If you require any further information about this opportunity, please contact the hiring manager Simon Skene via 0438 298 005

To be eligible to apply for this role, you must meet one of the following statuses: 

  • an Australian Citizen;
  • a permanent resident of Australia; or
  • a New Zealand citizen.

Prior to commencement, the successful candidate will be required to undergo a rigorous National Police (criminal history) Check and obtain and maintain a Security Clearance as determined by the NSW Police Force.

Our commitment to Diversity:

The NSW Police Force is a proud employer of a diverse range of people. We are committed to reflecting the diverse community we serve and creating an inclusive and respectful workplace for all employees. Differences are embraced, contributions are valued, and everyone has a sense of connection and belonging.

We welcome people with diverse skills, experiences, perspectives and backgrounds and encourage applications from Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander peoples, and individuals who may identify as LGBTIQ, with disability, a culturally and linguistically diverse background, and people of all ages.

If you identify as a person with disability and require further information on the role or you require specific arrangements to participate in the recruitment process, please contact the HR Diversity Team by email at PCC-INCLUSION@police.nsw.gov.au.

If you identify as Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander and would like assistance with your application, please contact the NSWPF Aboriginal Employment & Engagement team at PCC-AEET@police.nsw.gov.au.

This recruitment may be used to create a Talent Pool for similar future roles (ongoing or temporary) that may arise over the next 18 months.

For more information on applying for roles with the NSW Police Force click here

Thank you for your interest in this role. We look forward to receiving your application.

description:
Are you passionate about IT technology solutions and skilled in the IT Support, Cyber Security and Advanced Business networks? Are you looking for an exciting opportunity to join a dynamic team and drive business growth in the IT industry? Look no further! We are seeking a talented and motivated IT Support Technician to join our team in Mildura.

Company Overview:  

Technado’s vision is to empower businesses through IT technology solutions. Bring world class cyber security and data protection too small to medium businesses. Keep ourselves accountable and continuously elevate our service to the next level.  

Technado is an IT MSP Company, and our purpose is to improve our customers businesses through technology by making IT easy and not adding unnecessary complexity, providing them with old school face to face service that is often lacking today. Our focus is on building strong, long-lasting relationships with our customers by understanding their needs, delivering personalized IT recommendations, and having them see our staff as part of their team. Ultimately, we work and live together in the same communities, we must act like it.  

Position Overview: 

The IT technician will install and maintain computer systems, networks and servers aiming for the highest functionality. The IT technician will also ensure efficient use of applications and equipment. The goal is to build and maintain updated and efficient servers, computer systems and networks.  To roll out Cyber Security best practises and Cloud Solutions to clients. 

Objectives of this role 

Support requests: Maintaining IT systems so employees can work effectively and efficiently.  Provide computer and technical support to employees and clients. 

Technical specialist: Provide IT recommendations for clients and businesses. 

Network Admin: Run site maintenance tasks and proactive maintenance for clients and businesses. 

Project work: Design, setup and install new computer systems, cloud services, servers and network equipment. 

Protect Clients: implement and improve cyber security practices at various levels. 

Responsibilities of this role 

Cloud system Planning, designing, developing, configuring and commissioning networks and cloud systems. Mostly Microsoft 365 products. 

Monitoring the overall performance of systems to assess the need for updates, upgrades, enhancements, preventive maintenance and new systems.  

Recommending options for upgrading and improving the performance of networks and systems. 

Manage domains, DNS and customer email setup. 

Providing troubleshooting and service support in diagnosing, resolving and correcting problems. 

Developing and documenting strategies, policies and procedures relating to the use of IT technologies and services.  Determining software and hardware requirements to provide solutions to problems. 

Assessing the performance of IT technologies and services, identifying limitations and inefficiencies, and recommending and implementing solutions. 

Providing troubleshooting and service support in diagnosing, resolving and correcting problems associated with the use of IT technologies and service. 

Ensuring efficient use of applications and equipment. 

Repairing and replacing peripheral equipment such as computers, printers and routers. 

Providing information relating to cyber security and services that need added technical knowledge. 

Assisting with proposals when expert technical knowledge is required. 

 

Competitive base salary. 

Ongoing training and professional development opportunities.  

Opportunity for career growth and advancement within a rapidly expanding organization.  

Dynamic and collaborative work environment with a supportive team. 

If you are a motivated and results-oriented individual with a passion for technology and cyber security, we want to hear from you! Join our team and help drive success together in the exciting world of IT Managed Services.  

How to Apply:  

To apply for this position, please submit your resume and a cover letter outlining your relevant experience and why you believe you would be a great fit for this role. We look forward to reviewing your application and discussing the opportunity further with qualified candidates.  

   

Technado

description:
Hall & Prior Health & Aged Care Group is a family-owned aged care provider operating 36 residential aged care homes, with in-home and community care programs in WA and NSW. We believe that our commitment to providing high quality care can make a real difference to the lives of our consumers and their families.

We are seeking a skilled HR System Administrator to join our ICT team on a full-time basis, based out of our Freshfields facility in Carlisle.

About the role

Reporting to Senior Manager – ICT Applications, you will be responsible for ensuring our HR Information System is secure, efficient, and aligned with our organisation’s goals, optimising the day-to-day workflows of our HR and Payroll team. This role will also assist with any technical queries relating to our HRIS, as well as providing guidance and support for any optimisations and enhancements within the system.

What you’ll need to succeed?

To be successful in the role, you’ll need to possess the following:

  • Experience in managing changes to HRIS processes or systems, including user acceptance testing and feedback collection
  • Familiarity with HR processes such as recruitment, onboarding, performance management, and employee relations
  • Previous experience in training staff on HRIS functionalities and providing ongoing technical support
  • SQL database management, analysis and reporting
  • Experience providing technical support to HR staff and end-users, addressing system-related issues and inquiries
  • National Police Clearance (obtained in last six months)
  • Evidence of 2024 Influenza vaccination (or be willing to obtain)
  • Full working rights in Australia

What we have to offer

Our people are integral to achieving our vision of being a leading aged care provider in Australia. As well as being part of an inspiring and rewarding working environment, the benefits of working for Hall & Prior include a competitive remuneration package, flexible work arrangements, access to retail discounts via flareHR app, ongoing training and development opportunities and commitment to employee wellness.

What to do now

If this sounds like the role for you, apply now!

To view our suite of homes across WA and NSW, click here

As an equal opportunity employer, we encourage people from diverse backgrounds to apply.

Compassionate people, dedicated to care.

description:
About Accenture 

Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries, we offer Strategy and Consulting, Technology and Operations services and Accenture Song — all powered by the world’s largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers. Our 750,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success for our clients, people, shareholders, partners and communities. Visit us at www.accenture.com.

Join Accenture and help transform leading organisations and communities around the world.  The sheer scale of our capabilities and client engagements and the way we collaborate, operate and deliver value provides an unparalleled opportunity to grow and advance.  Choose Accenture and make delivering innovative work part of your extraordinary career. 

Required Skills

  • 3+ years of experience in Design and Implementation using skills in routing, switching, wireless technologies

  • 2+ years’ experience in design and implementation of SD-LAN and SD-WAN solution ( Juniper SD-LAN experience is desirable)

  • Design and implementation of Cloud networking solution for Google, Azure and AWS Cloud Platform (Minimum one Cloud platform experience is preferred )

  • Design and implementation of NexGen firewalls from leading vendors such as Cisco, Juniper, Palo Alto.

  • Experience in developing technical design documentation such as high-level design, low-level design, bill of material (BoM), configuration templates.

  • Develop network testing strategy, Test plans and testing execution.

  • Build cut-over/implementation plan in compliance with client's change management process. 

  • Support troubleshooting efforts during implementation and post go-live support.

  • Strong documentation and presentation skills with a focus on quality.

Due to the secure nature of the role, Australian citizens with a federal government security clearance will be preferred.

Benefits of working at Accenture:

  • 18 weeks paid parental leave

  • Long & short-term career break opportunities

  • Structured career development program

  • Local and international career opportunities.

  • Certified as a Family Inclusive Workplace™

  • Flexible Work Arrangements - centered around Accenture’s Truly Human ethos and our commitment to supporting the health and wellbeing of our people.

  • We are proud to be in the top 3 of last year’s Diversity & Inclusion Index!

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement for Australia:

At Accenture, we recognise that our people are multi-dimensional, and we create a work environment where all people feel like they can bring their authentic selves to work, every day.

Our unwavering commitment to inclusion and diversity unleashes innovation and creates a culture where everyone feels they have equal opportunity. Our range of progressive policies support flexibility in ‘where’, ‘when’ and ‘how’ our people work to ensure that Accenture is an organisation where you can strive for more, achieve great things and maintain the balance and wellbeing you need.

We encourage applications from all people, and we are committed to removing barriers to the recruitment process and employee lifecycle. All employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, disability status, ethnicity, gender, gender identity or expression, religion or sexual orientation and we do not tolerate discrimination. If you require adjustments to the recruitment process or have a preferred communication method, please email exectalent@accenture.com and cite the relevant Job Number, or contact us on +61 2 9005 5000.

To ensure our workplace is inclusive and diverse we are setting bold goals and taking comprehensive action. To achieve these goals, we collect information that allows us to track the effectiveness of our Inclusion and Diversity programs. Learn how Accenture protects your personal data and know your rights in relation to your personal data. Read more about our Privacy Statement.

description:
Tesserent is a full-service cybersecurity solutions provider. We partner with clients across Australia and New Zealand in the protection of their digital assets. With offices across Australia and New Zealand, we partner with clients to provide a full suite of cybersecurity services. Our mission is to be the sovereign cybersecurity provider of choice for the protection of Australia and New Zealand’s digital assets.

Tesserent are looking for a skilled and motivated security consultant to join our team of Canberra-based offensive security specialists. In this role you will work closely with clients to deliver Penetration Testing and Assurance works to cover a range of systems. This role is for an experienced individual who can provide cybersecurity advice to customers; and work collaboratively in team of Penetration Testers.

The successful application will have a demonstrable knowledge of offensive security tooling, and ability to articulate impact from identified vulnerabilities. A strong knowledge of coding and programming skills will be highly regarded. Good communication and inter-personal skills and a willingness to participate in team activities.

This role is based in Canberra and requires the successful applicant to hold a current NV1 security clearance.

Role Responsibilities:

  • Ability to understand and articulate technical information around security practices, standards and cybersecurity, identifying risks and suggested improvements to support business operations,
  • Strong knowledge and experience with ISM essential eight and hardening guidelines.
  • Comfortable using Linux operating systems and offensive security tooling.
  • Deep understanding of computer systems, computer networking, and IT infrastructure.
  • Strong understanding of both front and backend web technologies and communication protocols.

Role Requirements: 

  • Review system documentation and source code to assess security posture of a target platform.
  • Perform penetration testing on web applications, mobile applications, networks, and systems.
  • Utilise a range of offensive security tooling and techniques to identify vulnerabilities.
  • Document and demonstrate exploit chains and attack vectors
  • Engage with clients to understand their security needs and requirements.
  • Plan and manage penetration testing engagements, ensuring they are delivered on time and within scope.
  • Communicate clearly and effectively with clients throughout the engagement, from initial consultation to final debrief.
  • Work with client's development and operations teams to advise on security best practices.
  • Assist in the development and implementation of security policies and procedures.

Knowledge, Skills & Experience:

  • Any relevant education or industry experience will be considered.
  • Candidates holding one of the following certificates will be highly regarded: GPEN, GWAPT, GMOB, GXPN, GCPN, OSCP, OSWE, OSEP, OSEE, CREST, CISSP
  • Demonstrated technical penetration testing experience and knowledge of security fundamentals.
  • Experience working with Federal Government clients.
  • Knowledge of security practices in large organisations.
  • Knowledge of Federal Government IT Security standards.
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

Benefits:

  • Opportunities to undertake technical training and secure industry recognised certifications.
  • Flexible working arrangement with a healthy mix of remote and in-person work.
  • Opportunities to work with some of the best cybersecurity professionals in the region, and to grow and develop your career.
  • Extra leave day per year for your birthday.

description:
Job Advertisement: SIEM Consultant
Location: Remote/On-site options available
Company: Ethan
Employment Type: Full-time
Experience Level: Senior (10+ years)
About Us:
At Ethan, we are dedicated to delivering innovative solutions that protect our clients’ digital landscapes. We pride ourselves on our collaborative culture and commitment to excellence. As we expand our portfolio of exciting projects, we are looking for a seasoned SIEM Consultant to join our team immediately.
Position Overview:
We are seeking an experienced SIEM Consultant with a strong background in Azure, Mitel, networking, VPN, and security to help us enhance our security posture and streamline our operations. You will play a key role in implementing and optimizing security information and event management solutions for our diverse clientele.
Key Responsibilities:
  • Design, implement, and manage SIEM solutions tailored to client needs.
  • Analyze and respond to security incidents and threats in real-time.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate SIEM tools with Azure, Mitel, and networking environments.
  • Develop and maintain security policies, procedures, and documentation.
  • Conduct risk assessments and provide recommendations for mitigating vulnerabilities.
  • Lead training sessions and workshops to enhance team knowledge and skills in SIEM and security best practices.
Qualifications:
  • 10+ years of experience in IT security, with a focus on SIEM solutions.
  • Strong expertise in Azure cloud services and architecture.
  • Proficiency with Mitel systems and networking concepts.
  • Hands-on experience with VPN technologies and implementation.
  • In-depth knowledge of security frameworks and compliance standards.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently and as part of a team.

How to Apply:
If you are ready to take your career to the next level and make a significant impact at Ethan, we want to hear from you! Please submit your resume and a cover letter detailing your relevant experience to tom.morgan@ethan.com.au

description:
Business Intelligence Analyst 

The Client:
A Non-for-Profit organisation looking for a BI Analyst will provide BI and data analytics expertise to teams, programs, and projects across the organisation. They will connect and combine data sources, develop models, and design dashboards and reports to meet the business's needs, extending employees’ ability to make data-driven decisions and provide accurate and compelling ways for other stakeholders to do the same. 

Essential skills Required:
  • Expert skills in Power BI and DAX are essential
  • Skills in data extraction languages and processes, ideally Power Query and M language, SQL/SSRS
  • Skills in business intelligence and data visualisation
  • Skills in data analysis and interpretation
  • Strong interpersonal skills: a clear communicator, able to identify and clarify business needs, discuss potential solutions, and collaborate to get things done
  • Attention to detail to help ensure data integrity and accuracy
Key Requirements:
  • Create, maintain, and enhance over time reports, dashboards and other data visualisations in Power BI and other tools as appropriate to meet business needs.
  • Work closely with various departments to gather data, discuss business processes and understand key metrics to inform development work and troubleshoot any issues.
  • Identify opportunities for enhancing data- and BI-related processes and implementing best-fit practices.
  • Analyse complex data sets to identify trends and patterns, where relevant and appropriate
  • Interpret data and analyse results, e.g., using statistical techniques, where relevant and appropriate

Benefits: 
Work in a True hybrid & flexible working environment in the CBD, 3 days a week in the office. 

If you are interested in this role, please click ‘APPLY’ or alternatively reach out to Jack by emailing jack@emanatetechnology.com.au
